Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Decided to stop while shopping nearby.
Yelp recommended
Great authentic food. Family all loved their choices!!
Clean, friendly staff.
Good lunch crowd.
Highly recommend
We will be back !!
Yelp_Review.Name: Frank C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
4.5 stars
Hubby was craving Mexican food so after searching Yelp all the great reviews led us here. This is as authentic as it gets, the food was delicious. The tortillas for the carne asada tacos were freshly made, they were very good. The beans and rice were perfect, they were seasoned perfectly, the beans had the perfect consistency. Hubby enjoyed his enchiladas, full of chicken. You have an option to dine or takeout. They have an extensive salsa bar and the green chile is very hot. They also have a dessert case for your sweet tooth. We came pretty late for takeout, and people never stopped coming in the whole time we were there. Everybody here is very friendly and the service was great. The only reason they fell short of 5 stars is because the tamale was pretty basic. I will be back to try something else off their extensive menu.
Yelp_Review.Name: Simone T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've had my eye on this place for awhile and finally got the chance to try it today! As soon as I walked in I was impressed by the cleanliness and the vibrant beauty of the salsa bar. The salsa bar sauces and the house salsa were really good! The menu is extensive with a lot of options, and we had vegetarian cuisine on our mind. My husband and I settled on the VEGETARIAN burrito & quesadillas.
When our food came out shortly after ordering it looked so delicious and it was really delicious. It didn't cross my mind until we got our food to ask about pork being in the beans. The food runner quickly answered yes and walked away even though I told him we didn't eat pork and I removed the beans from my plate. I also noticed the beans in the burrito were the same. When I notified the server she informed us we would still have to pay for our "pork" burrito, but she could get us another one.
The experience of having to pay for an extra burrito that was advertised as vegetarian although it wasn't kind of outweighed the goodness of the food, but it's just a lesson learned. As an experienced server I don't understand the restaurant's policy but oh well. Just be sure not to order the beans if your vegetarian!
Yelp_Review.Name: Terran L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The best Mexican spot in Atlanta. Great food and service. Never have I ever been disappointed.
Yelp_Review.Name: Virginia C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: If you are looking for authentic Mexican food this is your spot. waitress was attentive and helpful when placing our orders. the food was ready in no time and the cost was on point. check it out if you want some original cooking
Yelp_Review.Name: Anthony I.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The most authentic I have had outside of Cali. Love their food but it seems lately when I get their tacos they don't taste the same as they did the very first times I have had them. So, I tend to choose other foods opitions. The service has never let me down.
Yelp_Review.Name: Loryn J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Tacos La Villa, watch out.
New Taqueria bae on the horizon. New to me. Where have I been? (Beside not venturing out to Jonesboro.)
My sister and I wanted to eat somewhere on one of our many jaunts up to Savannah. Usually we wait til we get there but knew it would be late so we hit up Yelp around this part of 75S.
SO glad we did as Oaxaquenña is legit. Tacos with homemade tortillas, delicious flautas (per my sis), and not-dry, tasty tamales. And THE BEST salsa bar of any joint I've seen in the metro area. Everything was super fresh. About 4-5 salsas (avocado-based one was WOW), big chunks of pickled veggies (including potatoes which was new to me), and other goodies.
Tacos, tamale, flautas, and two horchatas for about $20. Prices and quality are A+.
The reason they lose a star is because on our way back from Savannah we wanted to stop in before hitting the city. Yelp has them closing at 11:30pm on a Sunday which I knew was probably wrong. Their website says 10pm. We got there around 9:20 and walked in. The guy at the register said unless we ordered for pickup, they were unfortunately closed. Say what? I told him their website says 10 and he said it was a recent change. OK. In that case, update your website and, maybe, lock the door.
I think they possibly ran out of some things or maybe decided to just close early that night as several cars pulled up during this 3 minute timeframe and several other attempted to go in. As if this was not the norm.
Given the superb first experience, I'll forgive them and we will definitely return on our next road trip that takes us past Jonesboro. That flan is calling my name.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tamera B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great food with a fabulous salsa bar that includes guacamole. The authentic street tacos are the best, especially since I think they make their own tortillas in house.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jim M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
MMM! MMM! GOOD!
I bookmarked this restaurant in advance of today's visit because I am not familiar with the area. We arrived just before noon and secured the last parking spot. The restaurant was very busy today. When you enter the restaurant, you will have a colorful electronic menu directly in front of you and a salsa bar off to your left. Seating will be on the left or right sides of this area.
We were able to be seated at the last open table, which was a two-seater in the section on the left. The room was very bright and colorful and furnished with simple wooden tables and chair Here's a tip: The table for two is usually a rectangle set close to the wall so that you are seated at the end. If you turn the table so that you are sitting at the side instead of the end, you will have more room. It was a nice atmosphere but the music was a bit too loud.
They have a huge menu with lots of American options like wings and fries, (for the uninitiated).
We decided to order the medium quesadilla that came with beans and rice and an El Pastor taco. We were provided chips and salsa while waiting for our meals. Usually, I largely ignore the chips but this time I indulged because they were fresh and warm and had a delightful authentic corn taste.
We didn't wait long for our meal and when it arrived, everything was hot and delivered as ordered. The El Pastor taco had great flavor but was a bit too salty probably because it was marinated. Next time, I will try the non-marinated option.
The quesadilla was perfection because it was well seasoned, stuffed with vegetables that had a slight char, and it was not dry. The medium would have been more than enough to fill me up and the large would have definitely gone unfinished. The rice was nicely seasoned but I found the beans to be a bit salty. Although a bit salty, the beans were very rich and had great flavor, (like they had been cooked in a cast iron pot all day until those flavors hit their peak).
Overall, the food was very good and I definitely understand the ratings and why this place was so busy on a Saturday afternoon.
Definitely recommended, just watch that salt if it is an issue for you.
Yelp_Review.Name: Madelyn A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Definitely worth pulling off 75 and having a great Mexican food for lunch or dinner! We were heading south on 75 from north Atlanta and I was searching for a place to stop for lunch on Yelp and we hit this gem! The lot was fairly packed when we pulled in, but fortunately we were able to grab a small table that was perfect for a party of two.
After looking over their extensive menu, and being informed that their lunch specials were only available Mon - Fri 11 to 3 (this was Sunday) we opted for dinner items. My wife who is a big fan of tamales was thrilled to see they had a choice of four types to pick from! She went with the chicken with tomatillos sauce, another chicken with mole' sauce and a pork tamale with jalapeños. I opted for a new dish, that was their house special, a grilled or fried tortilla topped with your choice of meat, with jalapeños, tomatoes, lettuce, radishes, avocados, beans and a Mexican string cheese.
I was blown away with the size of the tortilla dish (for $12.99) as it was the size a of a medium pizza having at least a diameter of 14" (which would easily be shared with two or three people). My wife's tamales were all very flavorful and very fresh. There is a large fresh salsa bar that has guacamole and a large selection of salsas and sauces that we enhanced the already well flavored dishes. I was very pleased with the service. As you might of expected we had plenty of leftovers, especially when my wife wanted to try the flan. The flan portion was large and easily shared with two or more people being topped with fruit. It was probably the least favorite of the dishes we tried being denser than we liked and not as tasty as those we have had in the past. That being said their are a lot of other dessert options that I would try, having room when looking at the size of their portions.
Food quality and taste - 4.5 stars - Very Good Mexican food!
Service - 4 stars - Good for a very busy time.
Atmosphere - 3 stars casual, clean but nothing outstanding (I am looking for the best food!)
Price - 5 stars - Great value for money
Yelp_Review.Name: Ron P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great authentic food here. We all got tacos, I got mine a la carte. The campechano one was the best - sausage and beef, well cooked and spiced. The chicken mole was good too! I added the salsa from the chips and the pepper on the side for some heat and that helped as there aren't really any extras (tortilla, meat, that was it. one had onions I guess).
Yelp_Review.Name: Krista H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This is a good place to eat, authentic, tasteful, clean, good service, a more than complete salsa bar, music volume adequate, portions are more than decent.
Soy de bien comer y este lugar está recomendado cien por ciento, al menos por la experiencia que tuve yo, muy sabroso, bien servido y auténtico.
Yelp_Review.Name: Miguel G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Absolutely delicious. Place is always packed. Finally decided to stop in. Authentic Mexican food. Glad I did. I had the Fluatas from the lunch menu for $6.99 (drink is not included). Service is great too. Not a lot of seating but there is enough. Definitely see them out growing this location soon.
Yelp_Review.Name: Michelle G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Dish I ordered: Al Pastor
I was on my way back home from the airport then I decided to find a local restaurant to grab a quick lunch. Then, I saw Sonny's BBQ and I pulled in. When I was about to get off, I saw this Mexican place that looked great. As soon as I opened my yelp app, it told me this is a hot spot for authentic Mexican food.
As soon as I entered, I noticed a salsa bar that had guacamole, various salsa and vegetables. All looked fresh to me.
Al Pastor was a huge success for me. The pork was juicy and tender. Seasoned perfectly. They serve huge portions so I did not get to finish it even though I enjoyed it thoroughly. Rice was a little different I. A good way, cooked very softly so it's easily digestible. Sides of lettuce, onions, cilantro and avocado were very fresh and goes well with the dish.
I will definitely be back with my friends next time to try something different.
Yelp_Review.Name: Benjamin Y.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best steak tacos I have ever had in the US! Hands down! I could stop there but I owe it to those who will review comments to make a decision on this place to know that if they forgo eating here, then they will have made a horrible decision. The steak was cooked perfectly and I was given huge portions of it. The lettuce, onions and salsa were fresh and just made the tacos that much better. The corn tortillas were warm and perfect. You will not eat better authentic Mexican food than La Oaxaquena! This trumps the chain tex mex so many Americans like and is anything but tex mex. This is the real deal for real foodies looking for authentic Mexican food. Make it a priority to eat here! Service was great and the restaurant was well maintained.
Yelp_Review.Name: Joe L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The food is good and pretty authentic. The prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is more like a fast food restaurant and they will not give you free refills on tea or soda. It's a decent place for lunch.
Yelp_Review.Name: Carrie R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This place actually lived up to the hype! The food was so good! Everything we had was out of this world. We live in Marietta almost 1hr 15 min away it was not only worth the trip - I will be bring my friends here.
OMG the sauces were so authentic - the Tres Leche WTF!! Get up and come here.
Yelp_Review.Name: Norbert C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: One of my boyfriend n I fav spots in Morrow. I recommend the Horchata, steak & chicken quesadilla and the burritos are pretty good as well!
Yelp_Review.Name: Stephanie C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
By far the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to! The pork gordita was in the most delicious corn cake and the beef cheek tacos were out of this world good!
Prices are extremely good and the menu was packed with so many choices!
Yelp_Review.Name: Kate B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is my favorite Mexican taqueria since now! It's close from my work! I love the salad bar everything is clean and good cx service. They work as a real team. The menu is very complete!
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeniree O.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Joining the chorus of fans here. Oaxaquena may have the best Mexican food in the Atlanta metro area. I'm impressed.
Two visits:
Steak taco, Mexican. Super excellent. Nice soft tortilla, well-seasoned meat. Good beans. Rice just OK.
Chicken enchiladas verdes - outstanding, and you get four of them! Plus rice, beans and small salad. The green sauce is some the best I've had.
Queso tamales - I ordered two as take-out. They were already boxed up and ready for me when I checked out. Excellent tamales and a steal at the price.
Salsa bar is to die for. Best salsa bar ever. If you like hot and tasty, make your way to La Oaxaquena.
Free chips & salsa and even that salsa is good although I kicked it up three notches with the red chile sauce from the salsa bar. Chips were fresh.
Good service - the food comes out fairly quickly but it takes a while to get the check. The second time here, after sitting with a pushed-away plate for fifteen minutes, I eventually went up to the register and flagged my server. Maybe that's how you need to do it, although I saw several tables get their check in good time. Maybe it's just my server (same one both times).
Plenty of parking.
Highly recommended.
Yelp_Review.Name: Robin S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I had a torta and it was flavorful. Great seasoning on the meat and the avocado on the sandwich made it offset.
Yelp_Review.Name: Dee W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
First time visit (9/22/16) and my first impression upon entering is *dive*!
It's a small place, nothing fancy but have to say the food was fresh and good.
*Side note.....they need to renovate, make the place bigger and add some alcoholic beverages to the menu.....no margaritas a real bummer!
I will echo what others have said, seems pretty authentic when compared to the other Mexican restaurants in the area.
Son had the lengua taco (beef tongue) I had the flautas, both were good. If you are expecting the typical shredded chicken inside the flautas don't because they fry the chicken. Flavor was good but would have preferred the regular shredded chicken. Very fresh salsa and chips. I should also give a special mention to the refried beans that came with my entrée....must say that unlike other Mexican places they actually put some flavor in them!
Also had the mango bebida (shake).....it looked better than it tasted and was expensive @ $5.95. The flavor of the fruit did not come through well....
Will I return again? Yes, but next time will skip the shake. See pictures!
Yelp_Review.Name: Keysha P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Real deal authentic stuff. I mean you should brush up on your Spanish before coming here. I said dine in 5 times and she still put my order in a to-go box. I got the lunch special, $6 for over 15 menu items. No drink included. I ordered the chicken burrito and it came with rice and beans. I also ordered the mango juice. Pretty good, not overly sweet. They also give chips and salsa if you dine in. It was overall pretty good, I might stop by next time I'm in the area
Yelp_Review.Name: LaShonda H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Love love love this place. Food quality and service is spectacular. I got a little too happy my first time there and over ordered but it was so worth it. Very authentic. This place is never a disappointment. Marinated pork taco was seasoned very well. Topped it with some spicy salsa which was great. Chorizo taco was a little salty but still delish. My favorite has to be their steak taco. Their wings are always a good size, can't go wrong there. There's also complimentary chips and salsa!
Yelp_Review.Name: Lisa H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I really like this place! Very authentic Mexican food. I had the flutas and my husband had the beef tacos. We both had the mango juice which tasted as if a fresh mango had been squeezed into our cup! The chips came out warm and I loved the salsa bar that they had.
Yelp_Review.Name: Glennell W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Met here last Friday to celebrate a gym buddy's bday. I'm going to be totally honest here, sometime last year some friends and I popped in here randomly but we chose not to eat here because of the health inspection score posted..I think it was like 70 or 80 something at the time (clutched pearls). During this visit I was super skeptical and had in my mind to just show up to celebrate, but not eat, however upon entry I noted that the score vastly improved and is currently at a 97 (A). Now on to the food, well my dish at least. I ordered the chicken enchiladas with red sauce--freakin delicious! I was confused at first because when the server sat the plate down, it had this big, thin piece of steak on it..okay, wasn't complaining. The lettuce and tomato served with it was very crunchy and fresh. The table tortilla chips I tried were not greasy, but slightly salty. They also had two types of salsa..be warned if you ask for the spicy (understatement) salsa...its beyond spicy and I LOVE spicy food, but I had to step back from that. No one at the table, there were 8 of us, complained about their food. Oh, you should note that they DO NOT serve alcohol here...so it's virgin everything.
Yelp_Review.Name: Devika H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: HANDS DOWN BEST SPOT in GEORGIA to eat authentic Mexican food! The service is hard to predict, between 3 and 5 stars depending on how busy they are-- but the size of the portions, the wide ranging menu and the consistent food quality requires this 5 star rating. This is the only spot in the ATL that I know of that serves vegetarian tamales,-- delicious, succulent, perfectly flavored vegetarian tamales. They also have a salsa bar so you can have as much red, green and avocado salsa as you want. One notable drawback: No margaritas :( BUT THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD THEY DON'T NEED A LIQUOR LICENSE. Parking can be difficult during peak hours.
Yelp_Review.Name: Thuy P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I'm a girl from Texas who lives in the deep south. Finding authentic Mexican food is very much a chore. I stumbled across Taqueria La Oaxaquena via a Yelp. It got good reviews, so I decided to give it a try. It was a little taste of the southwest in Jonesboro, GA. The carne asada is juicy and flavorful. I will definitely be returning when I'm back in the area.
Yelp_Review.Name: Chelle R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: We had the mole, a chicken quesadilla & tacos with a side of guacamole. The mole was just okay nothing remarkable..the tacos were just meat in between corn tortillas...no cheese or garnish...the quesadillas were fine but again nothing really to brag on..I was really looking 4ward to going here after reading the reviews but im was kinda dissappointed. Everything was hot and fresh and the refried beans had good flavor.
Yelp_Review.Name: Heather C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Taco Salad delicious, salsa very good and also tamales are mega yummy..., place very clean, service very good, desserts are real Mexican and good flavour.
Yelp_Review.Name: Brenda O.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Pretty damn good mexican food for atlanta. Being from so. Cal. I know whats up
Try the harache and the tacos
Carnitas are very good
Yelp_Review.Name: Shawn V.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: After coming in for lunch with some family I can see why this place is so highly reviewed. For starters there are plenty of menu items that I have never come across and always wanted to try. For example, cow cheek, tripe and goat are all options that are exciting to undertake for the first time. I appreciate the menu segregated into "mexi-american" and more traditional choices. Obviously, going with the later would be recommended and it gives you a feeling of traveling without ever having to leave the country. I opted for the mole tamale and chilli relleno. It's rare to find a restaurant that even offers mole much less takes pride enough to offer a variety. The flavors were deep, intense and almost chocolatey. The staff was friendly and prices are uber cheap so I quickly became a fan and will have to come again next time I'm in town. Thanks!
Yelp_Review.Name: Ben T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I live in Austin, Texas and have also traveled to Mexico 3 times. I LOVE good Mexican and hate bad Mexican food. The difference here is that the quality of the ingredients is super fresh, and their flavors are fantastic!
I am value shopper, and this place is even more amazing considering their prices. If you're in the Atlanta airport area, and you want Mexican food, don't go anywhere else!
Yelp_Review.Name: Rob J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is definitely the best place to get authentic Mexican food in Atlanta. They have everything you could want out of an authentic Mexican fast(ish) food experience, except for beer. The tortillas, tamales and mole are handmade, they have an incredible salsa bar, and it's the only place that has Tlayudas (google them, you won't be disappointed in the concept, or on the dish when you come and try them). On the weekend they have special hangover dishes like Pozole and Menudo. I recommend this place to everyone I know. It's LEGIT.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jordi C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Excellent. Fresh and prepared as it should be. It's a great sign when you see the natives of these dishes eating here and with good reason. Great homemade sauces and condiments. I recommend 100%.
Yelp_Review.Name: Al N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place has the best food ever time I go. Their staff is polite and fast. Never dine in I've always taken my order to go. Try the Tlayuda it's really good!!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Renee ..

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
What can you say?
Amazing food, huge quantities, and very affordable. I just hope with all these positive yelp reviews, there will be space for me in the future.
Yelp_Review.Name: Scott H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I came because of the reviews but. The service was not great she didn't check on us. I was eating and a damn spider crawled on my arm from the ceiling. I mean I know every place has them but I won't b returning. No Bueno
Yelp_Review.Name: Kashmere J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Well well I can't believe I've waited this long to review this wonderful Mexican restaurant! Had a meeting in the area with co-workers and found this place through Yelp! So tasty and very authentic. Had the carne asada and carnitas tacos. Food was wonderfully seasoned with just the right amount. Love the salsa bar. Co-workers had enchiladas, quesadillas- everyone loved the food. We also shared cheese dips and guacamole. I love chunky guacamole and this fit the bill.
You could tell this was a popular and authentic place with white collar and blue collar coming together to enjoy good food. It was very busy but service and food was very timely.
Can't wait to go again!
Yelp_Review.Name: Sherrie H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Decided to stop while shopping nearby.
Yelp recommended
Great authentic food. Family all loved their choices!!
Clean, friendly staff.
Good lunch crowd.
Highly recommend
We will be back !!
Yelp_Review.Name: Frank C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
4.5 stars
Hubby was craving Mexican food so after searching Yelp all the great reviews led us here. This is as authentic as it gets, the food was delicious. The tortillas for the carne asada tacos were freshly made, they were very good. The beans and rice were perfect, they were seasoned perfectly, the beans had the perfect consistency. Hubby enjoyed his enchiladas, full of chicken. You have an option to dine or takeout. They have an extensive salsa bar and the green chile is very hot. They also have a dessert case for your sweet tooth. We came pretty late for takeout, and people never stopped coming in the whole time we were there. Everybody here is very friendly and the service was great. The only reason they fell short of 5 stars is because the tamale was pretty basic. I will be back to try something else off their extensive menu.
Yelp_Review.Name: Simone T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've had my eye on this place for awhile and finally got the chance to try it today! As soon as I walked in I was impressed by the cleanliness and the vibrant beauty of the salsa bar. The salsa bar sauces and the house salsa were really good! The menu is extensive with a lot of options, and we had vegetarian cuisine on our mind. My husband and I settled on the VEGETARIAN burrito & quesadillas.
When our food came out shortly after ordering it looked so delicious and it was really delicious. It didn't cross my mind until we got our food to ask about pork being in the beans. The food runner quickly answered yes and walked away even though I told him we didn't eat pork and I removed the beans from my plate. I also noticed the beans in the burrito were the same. When I notified the server she informed us we would still have to pay for our "pork" burrito, but she could get us another one.
The experience of having to pay for an extra burrito that was advertised as vegetarian although it wasn't kind of outweighed the goodness of the food, but it's just a lesson learned. As an experienced server I don't understand the restaurant's policy but oh well. Just be sure not to order the beans if your vegetarian!
Yelp_Review.Name: Terran L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The best Mexican spot in Atlanta. Great food and service. Never have I ever been disappointed.
Yelp_Review.Name: Virginia C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: If you are looking for authentic Mexican food this is your spot. waitress was attentive and helpful when placing our orders. the food was ready in no time and the cost was on point. check it out if you want some original cooking
Yelp_Review.Name: Anthony I.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The most authentic I have had outside of Cali. Love their food but it seems lately when I get their tacos they don't taste the same as they did the very first times I have had them. So, I tend to choose other foods opitions. The service has never let me down.
Yelp_Review.Name: Loryn J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Tacos La Villa, watch out.

SO glad we did as Oaxaquenña is legit. Tacos with homemade tortillas, delicious flautas (per my sis), and not-dry, tasty tamales. And THE BEST salsa bar of any joint I've seen in the metro area. Everything was super fresh. About 4-5 salsas (avocado-based one was WOW), big chunks of pickled veggies (including potatoes which was new to me), and other goodies.
Tacos, tamale, flautas, and two horchatas for about $20. Prices and quality are A+.

Their website says 10pm. We got there around 9:20 and walked in. The guy at the register said unless we ordered for pickup, they were unfortunately closed. Say what? I told him their website says 10 and he said it was a recent change. OK. In that case, update your website and, maybe, lock the door.
I think they possibly ran out of some things or maybe decided to just close early that night as several cars pulled up during this 3 minute timeframe and several other attempted to go in. As if this was not the norm.
Given the superb first experience, I'll forgive them and we will definitely return on our next road trip that takes us past Jonesboro. That flan is calling my name.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tamera B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great food with a fabulous salsa bar that includes guacamole. The authentic street tacos are the best, especially since I think they make their own tortillas in house.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jim M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
MMM! MMM! GOOD!
I bookmarked this restaurant in advance of today's visit because I am not familiar with the area. We arrived just before noon and secured the last parking spot. The restaurant was very busy today. When you enter the restaurant, you will have a colorful electronic menu directly in front of you and a salsa bar off to your left. Seating will be on the left or right sides of this area.
We were able to be seated at the last open table, which was a two-seater in the section on the left. The room was very bright and colorful and furnished with simple wooden tables and chair Here's a tip: The table for two is usually a rectangle set close to the wall so that you are seated at the end. If you turn the table so that you are sitting at the side instead of the end, you will have more room. It was a nice atmosphere but the music was a bit too loud.
They have a huge menu with lots of American options like wings and fries, (for the uninitiated).
We decided to order the medium quesadilla that came with beans and rice and an El Pastor taco. We were provided chips and salsa while waiting for our meals. Usually, I largely ignore the chips but this time I indulged because they were fresh and warm and had a delightful authentic corn taste.

The quesadilla was perfection because it was well seasoned, stuffed with vegetables that had a slight char, and it was not dry. The medium would have been more than enough to fill me up and the large would have definitely gone unfinished. The rice was nicely seasoned but I found the beans to be a bit salty. Although a bit salty, the beans were very rich and had great flavor, (like they had been cooked in a cast iron pot all day until those flavors hit their peak).
Overall, the food was very good and I definitely understand the ratings and why this place was so busy on a Saturday afternoon.
Definitely recommended, just watch that salt if it is an issue for you.
Yelp_Review.Name: Madelyn A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Definitely worth pulling off 75 and having a great Mexican food for lunch or dinner! We were heading south on 75 from north Atlanta and I was searching for a place to stop for lunch on Yelp and we hit this gem! The lot was fairly packed when we pulled in, but fortunately we were able to grab a small table that was perfect for a party of two.
After looking over their extensive menu, and being informed that their lunch specials were only available Mon - Fri 11 to 3 (this was Sunday) we opted for dinner items. My wife who is a big fan of tamales was thrilled to see they had a choice of four types to pick from! She went with the chicken with tomatillos sauce, another chicken with mole' sauce and a pork tamale with jalapeños. I opted for a new dish, that was their house special, a grilled or fried tortilla topped with your choice of meat, with jalapeños, tomatoes, lettuce, radishes, avocados, beans and a Mexican string cheese.
I was blown away with the size of the tortilla dish (for $12.99) as it was the size a of a medium pizza having at least a diameter of 14" (which would easily be shared with two or three people). My wife's tamales were all very flavorful and very fresh. There is a large fresh salsa bar that has guacamole and a large selection of salsas and sauces that we enhanced the already well flavored dishes. I was very pleased with the service. As you might of expected we had plenty of leftovers, especially when my wife wanted to try the flan. The flan portion was large and easily shared with two or more people being topped with fruit. It was probably the least favorite of the dishes we tried being denser than we liked and not as tasty as those we have had in the past. That being said their are a lot of other dessert options that I would try, having room when looking at the size of their portions.
Food quality and taste - 4.5 stars - Very Good Mexican food!
Service - 4 stars - Good for a very busy time.
Atmosphere - 3 stars casual, clean but nothing outstanding (I am looking for the best food!)
Price - 5 stars - Great value for money
Yelp_Review.Name: Ron P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great authentic food here. We all got tacos, I got mine a la carte. The campechano one was the best - sausage and beef, well cooked and spiced. The chicken mole was good too! I added the salsa from the chips and the pepper on the side for some heat and that helped as there aren't really any extras (tortilla, meat, that was it. one had onions I guess).
Yelp_Review.Name: Krista H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This is a good place to eat, authentic, tasteful, clean, good service, a more than complete salsa bar, music volume adequate, portions are more than decent.
Soy de bien comer y este lugar está recomendado cien por ciento, al menos por la experiencia que tuve yo, muy sabroso, bien servido y auténtico.
Yelp_Review.Name: Miguel G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Absolutely delicious. Place is always packed. Finally decided to stop in. Authentic Mexican food. Glad I did. I had the Fluatas from the lunch menu for $6.99 (drink is not included). Service is great too. Not a lot of seating but there is enough. Definitely see them out growing this location soon.
Yelp_Review.Name: Michelle G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Dish I ordered: Al Pastor
I was on my way back home from the airport then I decided to find a local restaurant to grab a quick lunch. Then, I saw Sonny's BBQ and I pulled in. When I was about to get off, I saw this Mexican place that looked great. As soon as I opened my yelp app, it told me this is a hot spot for authentic Mexican food.
As soon as I entered, I noticed a salsa bar that had guacamole, various salsa and vegetables. All looked fresh to me.
Al Pastor was a huge success for me. The pork was juicy and tender. Seasoned perfectly. They serve huge portions so I did not get to finish it even though I enjoyed it thoroughly. Rice was a little different I. A good way, cooked very softly so it's easily digestible. Sides of lettuce, onions, cilantro and avocado were very fresh and goes well with the dish.
I will definitely be back with my friends next time to try something different.
Yelp_Review.Name: Benjamin Y.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best steak tacos I have ever had in the US! Hands down! I could stop there but I owe it to those who will review comments to make a decision on this place to know that if they forgo eating here, then they will have made a horrible decision. The steak was cooked perfectly and I was given huge portions of it. The lettuce, onions and salsa were fresh and just made the tacos that much better. The corn tortillas were warm and perfect. You will not eat better authentic Mexican food than La Oaxaquena! This trumps the chain tex mex so many Americans like and is anything but tex mex. This is the real deal for real foodies looking for authentic Mexican food. Make it a priority to eat here! Service was great and the restaurant was well maintained.
Yelp_Review.Name: Joe L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The food is good and pretty authentic. The prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is more like a fast food restaurant and they will not give you free refills on tea or soda. It's a decent place for lunch.
Yelp_Review.Name: Carrie R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This place actually lived up to the hype! The food was so good! Everything we had was out of this world. We live in Marietta almost 1hr 15 min away it was not only worth the trip - I will be bring my friends here.
OMG the sauces were so authentic - the Tres Leche WTF!! Get up and come here.
Yelp_Review.Name: Norbert C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: One of my boyfriend n I fav spots in Morrow. I recommend the Horchata, steak & chicken quesadilla and the burritos are pretty good as well!
Yelp_Review.Name: Stephanie C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
By far the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to! The pork gordita was in the most delicious corn cake and the beef cheek tacos were out of this world good!
Prices are extremely good and the menu was packed with so many choices!
Yelp_Review.Name: Kate B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is my favorite Mexican taqueria since now! It's close from my work! I love the salad bar everything is clean and good cx service. They work as a real team. The menu is very complete!
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeniree O.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
You know a place is good when their wings and fries are good and they specialize in Mexican food. Wings super crispy. Fries crispy.
Bring you chips and salsa. There is a salsa bar there too.
Corn Tortillas are thin and fluffy, is that a thing?
The Al Pastor (marinated pork) Tacos totally rocked my Boat.
You get lime, radishes, and whole grilled green onions to accompany your tacos.
The smell of hot corn tortillas, beautifully slightly charred pork, with cilantro and onions. Simple but deliciously decadent.
10/10 would try everything on the minion.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kevin N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: First and foremost we found this place on yelp and it was a last minute lunch decision... Our food took 30 minutes or longer to come out and they wanted to charge us 2.50 to refill the chips. I have never been to a Mexican restaurant and they wanted to charge for the chips??!!! LIke really????? Other than that the food was good and the fresh salsa bar was a plus!! I may give them a second try but this exp really put a bad taste in mouth! .
Yelp_Review.Name: Miranda B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: A true legitimate Mexican food place. The menu has a great variety of Mexican food. The tortillas are home made corn tortillas. I recommend a cold glass of horchata.
Yelp_Review.Name: Peto F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Good food but crazy busy. Expect to wait 30 minutes plus. It's my personal opinion since I actually ate here.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mr N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This place is ok. Its Mexican food. You cant screw that up can you?
the service is always top notch. They are on you quick and take your order fast. The food has always been good. Their 1/2 chicken is good. All the lunch specials that my friends and I have tried have all been very good. the price is also good for the lunch specials.
SO, the only reason that I dont give this place a 5 star rating is bc its ok. It;s not the greatest place on earth and if you only had one more mexican dish that you could eat, this would not be my final choice. Thats the only reason no 5 star.
You wont be sorry eating here. I recommend.
Yelp_Review.Name: Eddie R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Their salsa bar is lit. Their tacos are lit. And it's a all affordable. Clay Co's best little secret
Yelp_Review.Name: Kristin B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: We have been seating in this restaurant for 30 minutes and still no food and there is just few tables occupied and the waiters are just walking around.
Yelp_Review.Name: Saul S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best most Authentic and delicious Mexican food I've had since moving here from California. Even the Jamaica was bomb! I ordered the flautas and they were hearty and good. Prices are outstanding! The service was great too and fast.
Yelp_Review.Name: KHADIJAH J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Chicken enchilada with steak made two meals for me. The flavors were to die for. Another day I had La Cubana breakfast sandwich, another 2 meals in one. The orange juice was fresh and delightful. The dessert a Flan made with vanilla was like a creme brulee pie square, a much thicker consistency. The service I received was excellent.
Yelp_Review.Name: Sam V.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I've traveled throughout Mexico and this is the most authentic Mexican food in Atlanta. The meat is arrechera style, the best and most delicious for carne asada. The guacamole is fresh and there are many types of salsa for every taste. The only negative is that they do not serve cold cerveza. But maybe that's good too because there were many families present when I was there. If you want real authentic Mexican food in Atlanta, come here. You will appreciate the story behind Tacqueria La Oaxaquena also.
Yelp_Review.Name: Robert B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Worth the drive from Atlanta!
Service: incredibly polite, courteous, and prompt. Our server was a soft spoken young man who was very sweet and patient with us as we explored their huge menu.
Food: holy smokes, so good! Husband had the chilaquiles with verde sauce, and I had beef enchiladas with verde sauce. Their verde is flavorful with a heat that builds the more you eat (not stupidly spicy, but you know you're eating legit salsa). I've also had their tlayuda when a friend got take-out. Husband and I agreed that their chilaquiles were better than those of a certain "mex-tex" restaurant on the Atlanta beltline. Really darn good!
Drinks: no alcohol, so plan accordingly if that is important to you.
They fill alot of to-go orders, nearly as many as sit-down guests while we were there, so don't be shy.
Yelp_Review.Name: Christy B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: First off, VERY AUTHENTIC MEXICAN RESTAURANT. The agua de jamaica was very good. We ordered the Cubana Torta, flautas, and tacos al pastor. Obviously had to try their tacos al pastor. La Cubana Torta will make you full!! It is stuffed. The tacos al pastor were really good. They give you a lot of meat and "toppings" and real tortillas. Many places serve dry meat on tough tortillas, but I was content with theirs. And to top it off, they serve chile toreados which was surprising and made me excited since it is too rare that these Mexican restaurants serve chile toreados. Definitely worth visiting if you're looking for an authentic restaurant that serve amazing food and lots of it at a great price.
Yelp_Review.Name: Christian M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place just didn't live up to all the hype. The salsa bar was a nice touch but the food was just ok. They got my husbands order wrong and then his tortillas were a little on the stale side. My chicken enchiladas verde was decent but far from the best I have ever had. Service was also a little unfriendly.
Yelp_Review.Name: Shonda W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Excellent Enchiladas Verdes. We enjoyed La Cubana, the quesadilla, and the complimentary salsa and chips, but not so much the Menudo. We can't wait to try their tacos and other specialty dishes in the future.
Yelp_Review.Name: Joy S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Last date: Aug. 8 2015
I have been to this Mexican restaurant ever since it was a hole-in-the-wall (circa 2003). Back in the days when they would only take cash and they had an old T.V where they would play Mexican novellas. It has now moved to a much larger place and they take cash and now the waitress are bi-lingual.
I honestly only come here to eat tacos. Tacos de carne asdae, with horchata. The tacos are great, and they have about 10 different salsa's you can top it off with.
Would I eat here again -- Yup! Is it better then Buford Highway Mexican joints - Yup.
Food: 4.5 stars
Service: 3.5 star
-Andy
Yelp_Review.Name: Andy S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I was in the mood for real Mexican food. Awesome customer service. A little slow because of lunchtime. I can't wait to try this street steak taco. No Taco Bell here!
Yelp_Review.Name: LaLa L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Tacos are what I always get! My hubby is hooked on them too... Me encanta la carne asada tacos...
Yelp_Review.Name: Karla R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I had chicken enchiladas in a green sauce with rice and beans. It was okay...it was just a little too spicy. It also came with steak on top which was nice. The rice was good; the beans were okay I just I like my beans refried. My mom had chicken soup...she said the broth had no flavor, they put a chicken leg and breast, chucks of veggies and corn cut in half. She wished they were cut up more.
Yelp_Review.Name: Nonah G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
OK, me being born and raised in Southern California and living in Mexico was feeling good and hopeful about the good reviews..... Wake up Jonesboro, Ga.
The food here is OK, semi authentic.
The cheese dip was like water, the beans had good flavor, the torta was decent but lacked volume, the taco de lengua should have been served on corn tortillas, and the chicken taco salad was horrible....
This is just a fast food joint with high prices for little amount of food and what Mexican restaurant don't serve guacamole? And burritos with no meat?
Don't waste your time on this place if you want a real Mexican food experience.
Wake up America and quit eating garbage!
Yelp_Review.Name: Eric D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I love this place! The food is good and authentic enough if you know what to order. I typically get tacos, tamales, their Mexican pizza, gordas...I guess I've tried many items, but I'm always satisfied. I also love the fresh salsa bar.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tuni A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best authentic ethnic Mexican food I've had outside of Mexico ! Loved it ! I would definitely recommend this place! Be careful of the burgundy oil that is fire in a container ! The guacamole was fresh and delicious! I can say anything was bad! Service was great !
Yelp_Review.Name: Mark C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The best authentic Mexican restaurant in town. All of the dishes are great. The only play I would go for real Mexican food. Needs one in locust grove.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kimberly M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The food was very unsatisfactory not authentic Mexican food. very salty chorizo and poor service. Only good part was the aguas frescas that's it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Alexa J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Extremely poor service. We came in about the same time as 2 other parties. Both of those tables got their food way before us. In addition to the long wait we never got drink refills and at the end of our meal I asked for a couple boxes and we only were brought 1. The waitress was not attentive at all. Maybe the waitress was racist as the tables that were taken care of fast and well, the customers were Latino.
Yelp_Review.Name: Angela J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I never would have expected phenomenal Mexican this far out of Atlanta (even Atlanta was a Mexican food desert until recently), due to the likelihood that the customer base wants something that more resembles a taco from Old El Paso then from a street corner in Oaxaca. I WAS WRONG! Taqueria La Oaxaquena was amazing and true to what I've experienced in the food Mecca of Mexico, Oaxaca. I can recommend this humble but delicious Oaxaca restaurant enough. The food is worth the ride, even if you only wanted to get their yummy salsa!
Yelp_Review.Name: S W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Wow their menu is extensive! I am trying tacos including buche- pork stomach excellent cabeza- cows cheek excellent- lengua-beef tongue excellent mole-chicken in mole sauce pretty good but I'll pass next time. Always wanted to taste mole though. Lastly pastor sopes- marinated pork wonderful! The meat is the most tender melt in your mouth full of flavor making my mouth happy thing of bliss! I wish I could have given five stars because the food is definitely worth it but the restaurant is cold, I have my coat on. My food is mouth watering but I'm daydreaming about getting back to my car and blasting the heater. My waiter didn't speak English. Yes it's a Mexican restaurant but I'm an American and I had questions about the menu. A waitress mopped the entire area that myself and five other couples were eating at and her mop bucket hit the table by my food. Cleanliness that's great...while I'm eating next to my food...I'll pass.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kimberly N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is a solid Mexican experience. ATL has no shortage of great Mexican food. This is more "authentic" I guess one could say. Major plus points: salsa bar, entree list and service.
Yelp_Review.Name: Ryan M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Seven dollars. Yes, 3 filling tacos (al pastor, carnita, and chicken mole) for 7 dollars. Each one was so good i could have had a plate with just that kind...but why limit yourself? Fresh, tasty, and the tortillas were heated on a kitchen grill before being filled. Fast service, clean surroundings, and did I mention price? I'll be going back tonight!
Yelp_Review.Name: Sally H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I dont know how to pronounce it. But i do know how to get there! Great food. Friendly service. Personally, I love it!
Yelp_Review.Name: Lizzy M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Had a very good meal here. Can't believe how many pretty good Mexican places Atlanta has, who knew? Meal was good and service was super nice. Only reason I could not rate it higher was I ate at another local place and the food was better and much cheaper but I would still suggest this it will not disappoint.
Yelp_Review.Name: Truck C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The service, food and atmosphere was very laid back. The chicken and steak tacos were very good. My wife had a medium chicken burrito which was enough for 2 people. The burrito was grilled which took the taste to a new level. The salsa bar was a unique twist to this authentic Mexican experience. Also, the bathrooms were the cleanest we have experience in a long time. All of this at 7:30 on a Friday night.
Yelp_Review.Name: Ronnie W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Fresh, delicious Mexican food, minutes from I-75 and Southlake Mall. Portions are big, prices are reasonable, and service was great. Restaurant is immaculate, and staff were ever-cleaning and replacing items on the (free!) salsa bar.
Agua frescas are delicious & inexpensive--under $3 for a 32-ounce cup of refreshing, fruity goodness. And it's only $1 for a 32-ounce refill, crazy. Milkshakes are excellent--especially mango--and taste more like fruit than sugar (a good thing).
Chicken tlayuda ($11.99) was good and HUGE. Beans, chicken, lettuce, cheese, avocado, and jalapenos layered over a crispy (or you can select grilled), thin tortilla. I shared and still couldn't finish the dish.
Chicken flautas were also very tasty; 5 served with rice & beans, and garnished with lettuce, lots of crumbled cheese, roasted jalapeno, and avocado for $8.25. Chicken enchiladas ($10.50) were good, 4 w/choice of red or green sauce, rice, beans, and salad. When the plate arrived, I thought it was incorrect, but apparently it's also served with a hunk of steak on top of the enchiladas. Unexpected but tasty.
The flan was incredible, best I've ever had. Rich but not overly so, nice bite but not eggy. $5 for a large brick of it, garnished with fruit. HIghly recommend this restaurant for great, authentic Mexican.
Yelp_Review.Name: Emily T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The flavors...OMG. There is truly NOTHING like authentic Mexican food. The Tlayuda appetizer fried with steak was insanely delicious! The flautas, rice, and beans were to die for, and hubby raved about the beef tongue Americano taco, and his two chorizo Oaxaqueña tacos. Excellent service and very clean interior. Worth the drive from west Atlanta!
Yelp_Review.Name: Tami H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've actually been coming to this place for a number of years and it's always been consistently delicious. The best part of today's visit is the 100 on the health rating!
I'm stuck between 5 and 4 stars here. Tacos are excellent and well priced. Love the al pastor and the tender tamales. No beer or seafood, which is a dud. Salsa bar is great. Especially the avocado/guacamole salsa.
Service was friendly and efficient.
Yelp_Review.Name: Chas P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great authentic Mexican food. If your from California like myself you will be extremely satisfied
Yelp_Review.Name: Natai D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
"Best Mexican food in Ga."
I live in Southern California and been working in Ga. off and on for the past 3 years. We stumbled across this place and it reminded us of home.
Yelp_Review.Name: Arturo D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
So I'm from out of town and in town to ship my car to Hawaii, stayed at the Hampton Inn and opened Up my Yelp app for a place to eat near me...
The reviews led me to this restaurant but I'm not gonna lie when we pulled up in the spot we weren't sure about going in...cause of the location. But we're not snooty so we have it a shot.
Super happy we decided to eat here. The waitress and staff were friendly and service was very prompt. Their menu offered a variety of authentic Mexican dishes. Their green and red enchiladas were amazing. Kids loved the junior tacos with rice and beans. Salads were complete with avocado slices and their fresh fruit juices were delicious. Prices were very reasonable.
While we were there it got busier and a blend of people were coming in to dine Including policemen/detectives.
The seating wasn't the most comfortable but the place was immaculately clean. I would definitely recommend this place and would stop by again when in town. Overall hella good Mexican food
Yelp_Review.Name: Bruno S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Portions are huge and it's the most authentic Mexican food I've seen in the Atlanta area in a long while. There is a salsa bar where you can load up on whatever salsa you want.
The upside? They have lots of chips and lots of salsa. The steak nachos I got were AWESOME! I would strongly recommend it. It's a great value, comes with cheese, steak, chips, and a bunch of other sides on top of it (and best of all, no sour cream that I don't like).
During the lunch hour, it takes a bit of a hand waiving to get them to come over to refill our drinks and such, but overall, I was happy with the service, food quality, etc. The one downside was the ambiance of the place. It seemed a bit run down. Other than that, I'd definitely be back there because the value of the meal (not super expensive and great food quality!)
Yelp_Review.Name: Peter K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Hmm....grilled cactus, what an experience. In all my years of living in NYC and eating at Mexican restaurants not once have I ever seen it offered on any menu. Beware if you order the large soda it's a monstrous 32oz cup that is more than enough for 4 people...lol.
The prices are downright reasonable and the quality of the food is top notch, very tasty and authentic.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jonathan S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Great authentic food. Had a quesadilla, which was delicious and my husband had cheese enchiladas. He actually didn't clean his plate (which us unusual) because it was too spicy.
Lots of other patrons were having soup, so next time I'm going to try the seafood soup. Oh and I wish I had seen the desserts before I had lunch because the flan looked amazing!!!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Maribel M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I HIGHLY recommend this place. The food is DELICIOUS. It's authentic Mexican food. Not the fake mozzarella cheese they use, but queso fresco. The parking lot was full but the restaurant is pretty big. Please be aware the portions are big. They are very generous. I made the mistake of ordering to much food.
The staff was friendly and outgoing. It's very clean and the prices are decent. Their desert menu looked really good. I was sad that I didn't get to try it.
If you are in the area you must go!
Yelp_Review.Name: Eunice S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I love their steak burrito. The peppers are so good. I love their guacamole that they leave out too.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kay B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Wonderful authentic Mexican food. Clean great homemade salsa bar. The flanges the best I have ever had. They even have wings. The garlic pepper wings are a must try
Yelp_Review.Name: Donalda M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Very good Mexican place on the southside of Atlanta. Tacos are authentic and fresh. Staff is always friendly and service is on point.
Yelp_Review.Name: Gunner P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
The taco thing has really taken off the last several years. I've been here, I've been there....and I as beginning to think that maybe I'm just not a taco person. And then I found this place. I don't often travel OTP, but at the insistence of a close friend, I trekked down to Jonesboro to try this place out. First, I'm struck that there are Hispanic people eating here. That's not very common at the Tex-Mex places in town. It's a sign, La Oaxauena is the real deal. The tacos were quite tasty, and the price point was just where it should be. The tacos are big. I ordered 3, and took 1.5 of them home. The barbacoa was delightful, it had that hint of gaminess you expect from goat. The beef tongue was a surprise favorite. The meat was tender and delicious. My third taco was chorizo, lovely all around.
The salsa bar is a sight to behold. Clean, and with a bevy of salsa choices to top your taco. To wash it all down, a (huge) cup of pina aguas frescas. Crisp and refreshing. All it was missing was a bit of rum. The one downside, this place doesn't serve booze. All in all though, a superb meal and well worth the trip. I and my dining companions had 11 tacos and 2 big cups of aguas frescas and spent under 30 bucks. The waitstaff were very polite to us. They were much friendlier when they found we had a Spanish speaker in the group. But the service was just fine before they knew that too.
If you like tacos, or if you don't, check this place out.
Yelp_Review.Name: Obadiah S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The food was OK. I expected alot from the reviews but when I ordered the food was just mediocre and the restaurant wasn't the cleanest.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mika R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
If you had to pronounce the name of this restaurant to gain access, many would be turned away. Luckily, they welcome all, and you should definitely come try this place out.
It's much more spacious than it looks, with rooms to the left and right of the central area. Ask for their lunch menu if they don't offer it (or if it's not dinner time) because they have combos for $6 and under.
Before I get into what I ordered, let me bring up the salsa bar, which has you originally asking um, is this free?? YES! They hit you with multiple salsas (the habanero salsa is no joke, you've been warned) and a really great cactus salad. Try it!
I ordered the steak quesadilla, which is already pretty big and very tasty on its own, but it came with a side of rice, side of refried beans and a large soda for right at $6. VERY tasty!
I noticed someone mentioned their burritos, and I saw one of the super burritos being taken to an unsuspecting orderer...that thing looked like foot long sub and a half. HUGE.....so yea, i'll be ordering it next :)
I will say if you're at a time crunch, you may want to let them know ahead of time, because we didn't get our food until 35, 40 minutes into an hr lunch. Also, chips are not on the house, like other restaurants, but considering that's half the calories, I don't mind not having them sat in front of me!
Fantastic restaurant, which provides both an authentic and american take on their dishes. Very tasty place, i'll be back
Yelp_Review.Name: Jamarcus T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: It pains me to see this menu has been updated with items like chicken wings and cheese-steak sandwiches to keep the average 'Murican interested. Fortunately, the good stuff is still on the menu. Since my last write-up, I have indeed had a tlayuda. And it was everything I expected it to be. (Except bigger.) Next time--the sopas, for sure. Holler if you're coming with.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mick D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Just found out that this place is right up
the street from me. My family loves authentic Mexican food. Josh, the wonderful server makes your dinner or lunch very pleasant. He is very informative about the entire menu. The service is fast and the food is cooked fresh to order.
You got to try the pork tamales. They are the best on my personal top 10 list. The only con about this restaurant is, that there is No alcohol. But I just grab a bite here and go by the package store for a cold Corona.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tracey H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: We just needed a Mexican place so we came here , it was full of Mexicans so you know its good, prices are really good and service was on point a nice lady who made sure we where doing good , I will definitely come back here and will recommend for friends
Yelp_Review.Name: E E.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Very good food. I travel an d look for good Mexican places to eat. I will be back here.
Yelp_Review.Name: George F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Very authentic Mexican place! I would prob give them 4.5 stars because I didn't like their guacamole. It was smooth and I usually like mine chunky but that's personal preference. Tortillas are made in house, flautist are awesome and I don't know what's in their salsa but I'd buy a whole bottle!
Yelp_Review.Name: Drew V.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: My girl is mexican so she is my go to gal for authentic Mexican food!! This place is the only place that she has cosigned authentic mexican food. Everything from the dishes right down to the sauces and salsas. We love this place! The prices are average and reasonable and they serve a plethora of authentic mexican dishes. I'm keen on going for what I'm used to like nachos and tacos only because that's what I thought was typical mexican food. They do have a portion of the menu that is "americanized" but broaden your mind and you will find that this place really tops it when it comes to mexican food. Service is good but majority of the staff speaks Spanish so conversation will be limited but as long as you know how to express what you want on the menu your in luck. I recommend the tamales, nachos, tacos on corn tortillas...not flour.
Yelp_Review.Name: Desmond M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The service was really nice although some of our food came out wrong.....The salsa bar was different (in a good way) and they gave us lots of chips which was good because our food took awhile to come out. Once it did, my chicken fajita quesadilla was small but tasty. Everyone in our party thought their food good. Not amazing or out of this world, just good food. We'll probably try something else next time.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mark L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is some of the best Mexican food I've encountered outside the southwest. We stumbled upon the place on a road trip. I was most impressed with the fresh salsa bar and the tacos. My wife got the sopas and raved about them. We will stop again next time we pas through town.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeff G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: When you first see the place you think, "can't be much" but what were you thinking!! A truly good, fresh-made Mexican food place in south Atlanta. Everything seemed to be made right here...tortillas, salsa, guacamole, tamales, and the list goes on! I ordered what I thought was an average size tostada-type entree called the Tladuya. That's probably not how it's spelled, but just ask for the "tostada thing the size of a large pizza!" Your choice of chicken, beef or pork. I had chicken. Excellent. Comes with refried beans slathered on the fried or grilled tortilla along with lettuce, tomatoes, long-sliced jalapeños, radishes, avocado slices and two different cheeses, including one that looks like pulled string cheese. The tamales are huge, again with your choice of meat. The salsas range from a mild to "take-the-wallpaper-off-the-wall" HOT. If you still have room after eating something like this, the desserts looked awesome and again, likely made right here. I'll definitely be back again!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Michael A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Wow. My husband and I were in the area, and Mexican sounded good, so we thought we would stop by. The parking lot was full, but we had no wait. The salsa bar had a lot of variety. Our favorite was the guacamole sauce and pico! We ordered steak, pork, and goat tacos as well as the chicken nachos. We had to wait a little while for our food, but it was worth the wait! Next time, I think we will just go for the tacos. The nachos were good, but the tacos stole the show! Authentic and delicious. My only real complaint is that our table was pretty rocky.
Yelp_Review.Name: Elise P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Sweet Jesus! After living in Atlanta for over 16 years I have finally located the Best Mexican Food in the City! Being from Los Angeles, CA eating Mexican Food is second nature. You practically grow up on it. So moving to Atlanta you are constantly chasing the So Cal High of Mexican Food. My GF and I felt like getting Mexican Wasted and wanted to try something new, so we hit our trusty Yelp App and located this spot. At first we were slightly disappointed that no liquor was served, but that got me to thinking if they aren't serving liquor THIS IS A SPOT. I immediately got excited because that means the food is on another level. We walked in and the placed was packed with families and working class folks. At this point I'm getting way too excited. We sat down and the menu was Bananas- all the good Mexican treats. We went crazy: 2 tamales, 2 sopes, a gordita, and a taco! I was in Mexican food heaven.
This will be the only spot that I will eat Mexican food in Atlanta now.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mike B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Good tacos and beet juice.--this is a hard place for vegetarians or vegans but the staff were friendly, the food was very rich/cheesy.
Yelp_Review.Name: Monica S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I have never had authentic Mexican food, but if I were to imagine what it was like this would be it, I will definitely be frequenting this establishment
Yelp_Review.Name: Ned H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
The flavor is good at the place, came here looking for some good tacos! They deliver. The tortillas are made in house so they are nice and fresh. The meat was a bit greasy for my liking but it had good flavor. I got lengua, tripa and buche. The Tacos are really big. (I like my Mexican tacos to be little that u can eat in two bites like the ones you get in Mexico, but on this side of the border is hard to get a small taco.)
The salsa bar was very good especially the guacamole salsa it really is good with the tacos.
Visit this place because it's good and try the fresh juice, it's good for ya and it really is a treat, I had orange, carrot and beets, yum!
Enjoy!
Yelp_Review.Name: Brenda L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: the mole is excellent but everything else we had was mediocre. very disappointing after reading so many positive reviews.
Yelp_Review.Name: Lea M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Favorite place to eat. Period. Pico and quac is free. Food is authentic and service is decent.
Yelp_Review.Name: Christin C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: their sopas were bomb! lol. i love how they have sooooo many sauces for you to choose from. simple as this... it's a pretty authentic mexican spot...def go check it out
Yelp_Review.Name: Suzanne W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Absolutely wonderful. Great food and even better service. I saw so many things that I must try. In order to do so, I will happily return as many times as it takes.
Yelp_Review.Name: J T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Taquería La Oaxaqueña: Two Words...THE BEST
The restaurant features the common fare of Oaxaqueña, in Mexico.
It's a very casual atmosphere, and most gringos can expect to be the only one on site. During my visit, we had the Oaxaca Tlayuda(Open-Faced Tortilla Pie), and Tamales.
Both dishes were fresh, with great flavor (region uses more garlic, ect). Along with our dishes, we enjoyed the SUPER FRESH salsa bar. I've had my share of Mexican food here in the states, and have been impressed with a few. I proclaim that TLO is my most highly rated and all others rated to this point are a distant second.
I strongly suggest any GA residents or visitors/travelers not to pass on the chance to enjoy REAL Mexican fare...delicious with great service on site. Awesome food worth 4.5 stars for taste alone...and I slept on this rating before awarding...
Also, they've got MTV Latino on Dish...so it's a party:)
Don't worry, they also cater to English-Speaking patrons...
Yelp_Review.Name: Wesley S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This is easily the best Mexican food I've ever had. I can't imagine there's anything better in the southeast US.
This is real, authentic Mexican food...not the Americanized version of Mexican restaurants that are so prevalent around here. (Not that there's anything wrong with those...)
I wish this place were closer to home...we would be regulars there, for sure.
Yelp_Review.Name: Ron D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've been going to Taquería La Oaxaqueña for a while now, especially because it's in my side of town. But I had to do a review and talk about how I'm SO HAPPY that Taquería La Oaxaqueña is getting the props they deserve. I was reading an article of Atlanta's Best magazine and to my excitement saw them on the "50 Best Restaurants."
Yes, for a lot of people it is VERY out of the way. But trust me, this is authentic as it gets and it's AMAZING food with humble service.
I usually get a hurache, which is made of masa ...similar in the resemblance of a sandal, that's where the name "huraches" came from. It's fried and topped with anything from steak, pork, or even lengua. (tongue) After that, there's various toppings and plenty of queso fresco on top.
They also have a salsa bar, that you are free to wander about and try.
Last, try the fresh juices they offer! The aqua de melon (cantaloupe water) is so refreshing.
If you want authentic Mexican food, you need to try this place out!
Only downfall is, the language barrier can sometimes be a little tricky, but they're really nice about it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Catherine N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Authentic great tasting Mexican food. The staff was very courteous and polite. I will return.
Yelp_Review.Name: Shey C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Basically the definition of a "hidden gem": inexpensive, tasty, good service, but in a run-down area and very basic furnishings.
They are very kid friendly here, almost to a fault, so if you are looking for a quiet, romantic get-away, this isn't it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Josh M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: What a great find! The beef chipotle burrito I got was fantastic! Beans are great too! Family got American tacos that looked great too. Salsa was delicious and the service was quick! Really good spot.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeff M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: My Favorite spot...SOOOO GOOD!!!!!! Love the customer service and fresh food. I always get the taco salad, so fulfilling. Love Beet smoothie. I can eat here each week. Family friendly. Never tried breakfast but heard it is delightful too! Enjoy!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Mmaat N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I wouldn't say the best in the city but this was definitely the most authentic Mexican restaurant I've been to in GA. With items such as cow cheek and pork stomach tacos on the menu, I would suggest trying this restaurant at least once. The staff was friendly, and the food was good. I kept it simple and had steak quesadillas. However I was a little disappointed they do not serve alcohol.
Yelp_Review.Name: Bre B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best Mexican restaurant in the Atlanta Metro area FOR SURE, HANDS DOWN! Very authentic, very home-y. Prices are reasonable, I haven't been disappointed yet.
Yelp_Review.Name: Loyda Z.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Out of all the entrees I ordered To-go for my coworkers and I, they forgot mine. When I called to let them know they told me I never ordered that. Even though I asked the server what came on and with dish and continued to tell him I'd like to order it. Unfortunately they didn't give me my receipt to go and show them. Wish they could have fixed the issue, not just a "perdon, que tenga buen dia." Had to settle for McDonald's, at least they put everything in the bag.
Yelp_Review.Name: Juan M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I had a weird lunch craving for tacos, and I normally get them from don pedro in Duluth where I am usually at. This time however, I was down south for a bit to see my parents so I yelped what was in the area for good mexican tacos. This little gem popped up, and I read through a lot of the reviews and was pretty open to try it for lunch. The menu was pretty massive in selections, it was so much I wouldn't even remember what was all on there. I do agree with everyone about the portions that they serve here. Since I am usually eye hungry, I would have ordered 4 tacos, I'm glad I played it safe with 2 because they are pretty great in size. I got the 2 carne asada tacos and had the sauces from the salsa bar to eat with it. They even offer guacamole at the salsa bar!! I also ordered 1 chicken tamale with the verde sauce just to see what tamales were. They were really good. As you can tell, I barely eat mexican food but tacos. If my stomach was that huge in capacity, I wouldn't mind trying the different entrees that were offered, it is just way to much food, and I don't like taking food to-go. Maybe one day when i'm in the area again I'll share it with someone. The prices were really good, and service was sweet. They also have lunch specials here, but like I said the menu was to big I was having a headache reading through everything since I was to hungry. I do find it pretty weird how there are options like wings, and fries on the menu..never ever going to try that though. They also start you off with complimentary fresh hot chips and salsa which were pretty fantastic! Great food here, and sadly I'm pretty far away from it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tran N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Best AUTHENTIC Mexican restaurant in town besides the 24-Hour Mexican restaurant on Old Dixie Road.
The staff is very friendly and sweet. The food is amazing! I usually go with my boyfriend and he sometimes order me whatever he recommends is good. (He's Mexican and him and his family goes there way more than I do.) Whatever he gets for me is usually very delicious.
They have a salad/spice bar which is very convenient. Other Mexican (or non-authentic Mexican) restaurants don't have a salad/spice bar. I would have to tell the waiter/waitress for extra spices and it would take forever and a day for them to bring it back out, so the salad/spice bar is a thumbs up!
I love their steak tacos the most! (I know, typical order.) It's so good!
Yelp_Review.Name: Rosie N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Was told this was a really good place for authentic Latin food.
One of the things that stood out to me was the huge salsa bar that they have here.
I just ordered a beef salad because you know...I'm paleo. It was decent and it didn't cost much because it was a $6.99 lunch special. I think they have this as a daily special.
The service however was bad. We had to get the server's attention several times and they got our food order wrong.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tom C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I have the distinct advantage of having my in law family and spouse who are from Oaxaca, Mexico (oh goodness, if you haven't been there, this is an awesome vacation destination and is absolutely beautiful). I visited there a few years ago since my wife's great, great grandmother was turning 100 years old. We had a huge celebration, peppered with authentic Oaxacan food and it was amazing). This restaurant, foodwise, transported me back to this city. It is in southern Mexico, nestled in the mountainous regions and is lush with fertile soils. The local market was endless and often we went to get our groceries. First thing I loved about this place was the "all you can eat" salsa bar. You can get a variety of salsas from mild to spicy, pico de gallo, nopales (cactus) and even pickled carrots!! That is just the start. By far my favorite was the clayuda (if you don't know it is misspelled in the menu! Lol). This is a huge "mexican pizza", a tortilla (corn or flour) topped with the meat of your choices (you can have more that one), tomatoes, lettuce, grilled jalapenos and authentic Oaxacan mexican cheese. I was instantly reminded of a middle aged Mexican women in the market street of downtown Oaxaca who had about 50 of the clayuda shells on her head in precarious balance, all the while belting out a nasal retort: "Clayudas....Clayudas aqui!! Yes I said it, AUTHENTIC! Like many different places in Mexico, the cuisine varies from region to region so anyone suggesting that this is not an "authentic" mexican restaurant is only saying so because their experience is not Oaxacan! The portions are HUGE---I mean GINORMOUS!! Two to three servings per person!! I also tried the beef caldo (soup) which was invigorating on a cold day. The perfect balance of guajillo chillis in the soup base was comforting. I highly recommend you try the braised/stewed goat meat dinner as well. The depth of flavors they achieved was notable and I found myself eating this a little slow to enjoy it more. This restaurant was filled with children too. It was interesting to see the facial expressions on my 7 mo old as she "people watched". I could tell she wanted to try everything (she is really not picky!) and I will bring her back when she is old enough. I usually do not venture forth into Jonesboro but if you are in the area, definately stop to eat here; and be prepared to box up the leftovers!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Adil A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Very disappointed. Bad service, bland food, messed up orders.. nothing positive to say.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kate W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The horchata is HUGE, so it might be nice to share one. Get the traditional tacos and you won't go wrong. Al pastor were my favorite. (Remember to visit the salsa bar!)
Yelp_Review.Name: Amanda R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Decent Mexican food but nothing that I'd write home about! Sopas ware good, but the Tostadas are rather pricy for what you get. Lots reviews seem to rave about this place, I just don't see why. There are plenty of other taquerias in the Atlanta area that are just as good.
Yelp_Review.Name: Richard K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've been eating here for a decade now, and I still haven't come across a better taqueria in town. That said, it's a little more "formal" than the average taqueria, meaning it's a sit-down place with a larger menu. But prices are comparable, the salsa bar is fantastic and offers some non conventional selections, and the food is beyond compare.
The thing you have to have at least once is the tlayuda, the gigantic Oaxacan pizza-ish disc that is still hard to find even after all these years. In my more bulletproof youth that was my only menu order - I'd have to call them ahead of time and ask "tiene tlayudas para hoy?"
