(though they became much more bilingual once they moved into a former Captain D's). But nowadays I only get one if I've been fasting for the previous 2 weeks or so. I've learned that the huarache quesillo oaxaca is an acceptable lower-volume substitute, and that the sope is an acceptable lower-volume substitute of the huarache. My routine as of late has been to get the latter with a tamale that has strips of peppers in it - yes, a taqueria with vegetarian options, believe it.
The only downside I can say about the food is that I walk out feeling like I have to avoid children, lest they be tempted to ram a stick through me and gather the candy that would spill out. Not South Beach Diet-compatible, in other words.
Still, you haven't had the best Atlanta offers unless you've been here. Comprende?
Yelp_Review.Name: Scott W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I've ordered the veggie quesadilla on multiple occasions and it is just fantastic. The salsa bar is incredible. At times the service can be a bit slow, and depending on who's there it's worth brushing up on your spanish, but the quality and authenticity of the food is just wonderful. This is a favorite of mine.
Yelp_Review.Name: Derrick V.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Well I guess i'll have to be the bad guy here. After all of the glowing reviews I had to give this place a try since I was on the south-side. The place isn't hard to find & once you get there you will find nothing but the locals eating here. So needless to say I stuck out like a sore thumb. Well there was a table of Asian-Americans across from us so they might have stuck out a bit more. Got the street taco's because i've always wanted to try them and the Oaxaquena one's are as close as i've gotten to street tacos. Had the Steak and Pastor Pork ones. The steak was OK, but the Pork was really good & i was sorry I didn't get two of them. Had the beans and rice with this and my sides were OK. It wasn't this life altering experience that others have had here or maybe I built this up to be more than it really is. I may try this place again but I won't burn the gas to go out of my way.
Yelp_Review.Name: Darren H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Fabulous service, great décor, best of all its food. I ordered a huge tlayuda, and I enjoyed it tremendously. It is like a humongous tostada. Love the place and waitresses are very friendly and courteous. A+
Yelp_Review.Name: Max M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Amazing and authentic! Best Mexican food around town. Salsa bar is fantastic and so was the service.
Yelp_Review.Name: Christie J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Some people will tell you Taqueria del Sol is the best place to get a taco in Atlanta. These are probably the same people that don't leave Decatur, let alone travel outside the perimeter to the South Side. Those people are wrong.
Taqueria La Oaxaquena is not in the business of serving you tacos with coleslaw, or cheesy stuffed nonsense. This is legit Mexican food. Its cheap, delicious and most importantly, authentic. If you're really adventurous, try the Tacos Estilo. You can get tripe, beef tongue, or BBQ goat just to name a few. The regular tacos are $1.99, and are served with fresh cilantro and onions. The Tacos Americanos are their regular tacos served with sour cream, lettuce, and tomato. The chips are free and endless if you're dining in, and they have a salsa bar that really puts the one at Moe's to shame.
This place is more than just tacos and chips though. The tamales are huge, although I wish they had a little more meat in them. They have special platters and soups, and even flan and smoothies for dessert.
If our service was better, I'd give this place 5 stars, but as sweet as our waitress was, she was really bad at her job. She wasn't attentive, and seemed a little scatter brained. We'll definitely be back though, because the food is just outstanding.
Yelp_Review.Name: Brea D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Hubby and I have patronized this local spot for more than a decade - since they were in a little strip mall on Tara. Back then everyone spoke only Spanish and it was a cash only operation. They now have bilingual staff, accept credit cards and grew to earn a stand alone structure around the corner from where they originally began. Food is delicious Mexican not a Tex-Mex joint. Service is pleasant and fast. Me encanta La Oaxaqueña!
Yelp_Review.Name: Lucas G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This is clearly one of the best Mexican restaurants in the greater Atlanta area. The portions are monstrous, the prices are low, and (most importantly) the food is delicious. Their cheese is especially delicious. Most recently, I had a burrito and a huarache. I recommend them both, but if I had to chose, I'd vote for the huarache--the bread is amazing.
On top of great food, they have a salsa bar where you can fill up on as much salsa as you see fit. It seems a little less than sanitary, but just don't think about it.
Tip: Don't eat one of their jalapenos when you're driving. I love spicy food and the first one I ate was fine. But the second one had been genetically modified (or something like that). I've never had a jalapeno so hot; I had to make an emergency road-side stop because my whole face was on fire.
Yelp_Review.Name: Cameron G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Now that I have been spoiled with authentic Mexican food in Los Angeles. I was skeptical about this place, to my pleasant surprise it didn't disappoint. I had a sample of 4 different items. I love a good al pastor burrito and this one was huge! Beans and rice were exceptional. This place is the real deal! I also like the Buche taco too (pork stomach also called hog maws). It's more adventurous fare but I enjoyed it grilled in a little taco. You have to take advantage of the salsa bar. Salsa heaven! If you are craving Mexican and on the Southside there really is no other option.
Yelp_Review.Name: Antiwan T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: First time, was just ordering food to take home. Great experience, everyone was super friendly. Ordered the torta de carne asada....que rico...it was delicious and came with some really tasty fries....will be coming back for sure. Maybe next time we'll sit down and it there.
Yelp_Review.Name: Cynthia R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Cute little Mexican restaurant....Ordered the quesadilla lunch special for only 6.99 which is a great price for what you get....chicken was seasoned and the onions all tasted great! Service was lacking a bit but other than that I enjoyed the food and will probably return.
Yelp_Review.Name: Brianna J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: So this place is a hit or miss for me some days it's good and some days it isn't but I do have to say that they have a short male Hispanic waiter or cashier that is just the rudest. He's been my server a few times and he will not be my server if I go and eat there again. In one occasion he followed us to the table did not introduce or welcome us and asked what did we want to drink, got our drink order did not ask if we want the small or the large size and just bought the big size to us. All the tables around were bought chips and salsa by their servers and he didn't even bother. Checked on us once and then when we were paying that's when he tried it. It was 3 of us and we all had our own ticket. I handed him my ticket and he charged me for the other persons ticket so he's like well ask him to give you his change and had an attitude. Like no YOU can refund me the money and YOU give me the right change. Had an attitude about the whole situation. And yes one bad incident can do it for me. They need better customer service and make sure they're food is good all the time not just sometimes. Other occasions it has been whatever since I place to go order on a blue moon.
Yelp_Review.Name: Sandy M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: It seemed hit or miss, possibly due to my American palate. We did not like the mole, the tacos were great, the torta was flavorful but very spicy. The portions were great for the price, and all the ingredients were fresh. The horchata is made in house, a bit grainy and thick but fresh and sweet. The flan was also fresh made and a nice sweet finish.
Yelp_Review.Name: Candace M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
This ain't your local Tacobell or texmex place, don't even dare come here if you want that kinda 'mexican' food. This place is legit and authentic!
I went here for one thing...Menudo. No, not that stupid boy band crap from the 80's but Mexican soup served with tripe. Yes, that is beef stomach, and it's awesome by the way. Don't judge until you've had it, it's delicious and a supposed hangover cure. And, it's only served on Saturday and Sunday, by tradition.
The menu is very eclectic and first timers will have a hard time deciding on what they want because the item selection is vast...my wife had the torta which was spicy as hell but damn tasty. Another person had a variety of tacos including the ox and beef tongue and a few others I don't recall at the moment...everyone left with a full belly and big smiles!
To go with the excellent food, service was very fast and friendly and the price was just right. So, step out of your comfort zone and get something different, you may just like it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Steven G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: First timer and it was great! Had some special steak torta "bomb af". Friends had some other stuff but overall this place is great.
Yelp_Review.Name: Brandon E.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Growing up in Arizona and Southern Cali I am pretty familiar with authentic Mexican food and this place is as close as it gets in Georgia! I am salivating right now just thinking about their barbacoa huaraches. From the wait staff to the salsa bar this place screams flavor! I would go every week but my wife is not a fan and it is a long commute for us but definitely worth a pilgrimage to food Meca. I learned a long time ago when looking for a good authentic Mexican restaurant you need to look at who is eating there. The last time we went we were the only gringos in the place which to me is a good sign. Prices are more than reasonable and well worth it. The atmosphere is dated and expect to listen to Telemundo or a football (soccer) in Spanish so bring good company if you only speak English. The waitstaff is gracious and they all speak English in case you have any questions. Definitely try their guac sauce and go out on a limb and try the lingua tacos or menudo!!!!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Wesley H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I hardly need to add my tiny non-Elite voice to the chorus of praise, but since I'm one of the few southside Yelpers, I'm going to plug a fine southside restaurant - Taquería La Oaxaqueña.
It looks like nothing - like a remodeled McDonalds. But the food - omg, the food! If you want hearty, filling, delicious authentic Mexican, this is the place to come, period. I'd recommend something specific, but honestly, just get what looks good - because it will be.
Losing one star simply because it's not a place to hang out and eat in a leisurely fashion - it's a bit loud, and the plastic benches aren't comfortable. Just enjoy the food, and move on.
Yelp_Review.Name: Elizabeth M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Made me feel like I was on vacation. Food was different and a great change of pace. We had the Mexican pizza served on a plastic serving tray. Enough to feed three easily. Also had the tacos and all were tasty. Salsa bar was a great bonus as we mixed a few to get the flavor and heat level that we enjoy. Look forward to our return.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jay T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The good is excellent! Very authentic and flavorful. The salsa bar is great.... with awesome guacamole on it. The service can be very iffy. I've had good service and bad service. Never great service. The food is awesome enough that i will continue to go.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kimberly B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Don't live in Atlanta, believed in the yelp community, found this little gem. You know it's good Mexican food when you are the only one who speaks English! And it was cheap!!! All the guacamole I ever wanted!
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeremiah F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Nice authentic, but still a lot of the normal american tex mex stuff too. Everything is great though! Even the rice and beans are amazing! Last time I went there, service was a little slow, I think because of someone new there, but I won't count that against my star rating which is mostly for the food!
Yelp_Review.Name: Jason C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Why this place doesn't have 5 stars is a freaking tragedy. This may be the best taqueria mexican restaurant I have ever been too. Name it they got it and it is great cabeza, barbacoa, pastor, on the most awesome corn tortillas. Soups menudo, soup not band, and 7 fishes are just perfect. Have a Mexican coke and finish with a piece of chocolate flan. It is so large it must have 10 eggs in it. Seriously good mexican.
Yelp_Review.Name: Erik L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I thought that I had found a gem... I have eaten here several times and really enjoyed the food. However you can only imagine how disgusted I was when I ordered takeout early one morning and saw several roaches. The young lady who was restocking desserts was killing roaches that had gotten in the dessert cooler. The bin with the to-go cutlery had roaches in it. Not sure if the staff was trying to remain cool or if they were just used to them. I really wish they would exterminate because the food WAS phenomenal.
Yelp_Review.Name: Urban F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Like several other reviewers, my main reason for eating here today was to see if this place lived up to the incredible hype. I was fairly confident that I'd be enjoying a delicious meal upon entering, and...boy...it was nice. I ordered 3 carne asada tacos at $2 a piece, while my girlfriend ordered a downright gargantuan carne asada burrito for $6. The seasoning on the steak, combined with the free salsa bar made these tacos close to flawless. Could not ask for much more out of a $12 meal for 2 people. Next time I will surely be more adventurous, everything on the menu looks great. 6 out of 5 stars
Yelp_Review.Name: Drew B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Place was great!! The chips were fresh bad crispy n salted just enough. The place was clean. The salsa bar was clean and had a lot of choices. The portions were huge. And I can eat a lot.
It's basic and no frills But dang the food was great. N incredibly fresh
Yelp_Review.Name: David B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Some of the best tacos in town! I am a big fan of their pork stomach tacos. However, their menu does offer a lot of choices in which I still have to try. One good reason I love their tacos is because of their handmade tortilla! Very authentic!
Yelp_Review.Name: Daniel C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
When you order chicken soup to go you get a huge styrofoam container of chicken broth with an intact chicken thigh and leg, whole carrot, whole tomatillo, ear of corn, whole potato, and a side container with chopped up fresh onions, cilantro, and jalapenos, "mexi" rice, and tortillas. Once you get home you will need to cut the chicken off the bone, remove the fat, and cut up the vegetables, then throw them back in the broth along with the side container filled with goodies. Once your prep work is done you can then slurp on some damn good spicy chicken soup. If you don't like to put work into a prepared restaurant dish you might want to skip La Oax's sopa de pollo.
I know you people think their Tlayuda is the best in the west..errr south west... of Atlanta (barely), I beg to differ. Not sure if I caught the pollo tlayuda on an off day, but the tortilla it came on was chewy and stale as hell. Maybe it is supposed to be like this. If so - I apologize tlayuda. Otherwise, I was hoping for a nice crispy bottom on which I could carry all other excellent ingredients right into my mouth with a satisfying crunch. I didn't get the crunch I was looking for which left Stephie a sad, sad girl. The ingredients that topped the stale tortilla were delicious though, which mostly made up for lack of bite. I would probably stick with the vegetarian tlayuda next time since I felt like the chicken didn't really add much.
Though I can't actually pronounce the name La Oaxaqueña, I will check their tlayuda out again just to see if the snap, crackle, crunch is back.
Yelp_Review.Name: Stephie Z.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I'm from San Antonio, TX and as we all know, finding good Mexican food in the deep south is like a diamond in a rough. Thanks to Yelp, i came across this place and it's actually pretty good. It reminds me of home. Their prices are reasonable and the portions are plentiful. If you do not live in Jonesboro, then you're out of luck unless you are willing to drive here. It's a busy place, so you will have to wait, but it's worth it. :)
Yelp_Review.Name: Kwayne B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Ok.. Um, no alcohol, where they do that at? This is the first mexican spot that I have been to that was a dry house... Not even a corona. Im not a drinker but I like to try margaritas... The kicker, my bf was excited because he saw a huge margarita glass, his bubble burst when he was told it was a mango milkshake. LOL Oh, food was decent, I was sooo excited after reading reviews from yelp. I walked in with high expectations. My favorite thing was the guac. I wanted to take it all home!
Yelp_Review.Name: Yolanda M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Really love this place. My girls and I went on a night out and had a great time. I got the half chicken plate and needless to say it was a take home...lol. Their 1/2 chicken is soooo good. Its was very spicy but I like my food that one. One of my daughters had the torte (chicken). I didn't know what it was until they brought it to our table. I never seen a sandwich so thick...
I love their fresh salsa bar. This is a great place to go.
Yelp_Review.Name: Conchata W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I have been frequenting this place since its' opening.
This is the best place I know for authentic Mexican tacos.
I love the salsa bar. I think it is a great touch that there are nopalitos (cactus) salad on it as well.
I cannot recommend it enough.
The staff is very efficient as well.
Yelp_Review.Name: Alane H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I have been here countless times. I absolutely love this place! I call ahead and order for take out(atleast 4 times a month) and we go in and sit down(around 3 times a month). I also love to take my out of town guests here.
My favorite is the steak quesadilla. My fiance loooves the pastor burritos.
We will be back!!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Janet W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
After the fantastic taquería in Rome, GA, and after all the rave reviews of this place, I was expecting better. Had barbacoa (goat) gordita, flat meat taco, rice, and an empanada with green sauce and another with red sauce. Also had some flautas sprinkled with crumble cheese.
Better than American-Mexican. But the ingredients could be fresher/better. It just seemed too mass-made.
Yelp_Review.Name: Zachary S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Hands down, the best Mexican food on the southside. The fresh salsas and salads that are complimentary with the meals are a culinary force that rivals other taqueriasin the area. The entrees are delicious and expertly prepared. The staff are friendly and very helpful and knowledgeable. I visit this place often and have never had a bad experience. Viva la Oaxaquena!!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Chef William S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Wow. I mean, WOW.
I don't normally get enamored by Mexican food - it's heavy, cheesy, and greasy. As I get older, I tend to prefer food that won't have me feeling like I drank a barrel of Saudi oil or as gassy as drinking a gallon of milk. However, Taquería La Oaxaqueña is a rare exception.
First, they have a salsa bar. A rather impressive salsa bar. Pickled veggies, pickled chipotles, and about 6 different salsa and guacamole dip. I ordered a basket of chips, carne asada, and just for giggles (thinking it would be about as small as Taco Bell), a gordita. When I was mulling more (the cheese corn always gets me) - the waitress told me, "señor, you don't need anymore - that's enough food." I am always appreciative of a server who is stopping me from stuffing myself like it's Thanksgiving in Spring and saving me a few bucks.
Once done, I got up to get some salsa. I picked about four salsas and some of the guacamole dip. But here's a quick recap:
Salsa roja - run of the mill tomatillo and chiles
Salsa verde - same
Guacamole dip - smooth, creamy, not straight guac, but it's still tasty
Salsa de gujillo - this red, creamy concotion was quite flavorful and not too spicy
Salsa de cachuate - WOW - smooth, creamy, tomatoey with a hint of peanut. I had to ask to confirm my suspicions - but once I found out, it went on almost everything.
When the food came, I quickly saw why she told me to quit. The whole table was covered in plates. Between my basket of chips, my plethora of salsas, tortillas, amy gordita, and my carne asada, I barely had room for my flatware. But, as my old jumpmaster instructor used to say, "make it happen, airborne."
I somehow managed to finish nearly all of it - I hadn't stretched my stomach like that in a while. The carne asada was two rather large flat briskets of flank steak and the gordita was completely stuffed with chorizo. Eating here was like having a siesta in my mouth where only I was in invited.
Now, a note for those who would like to suddenly flood the place - if you are in the southside area, you'll know that this isn't one of the best neighborhoods around. As a matter of fact, if you don't use a GPS, it's easy to lose this place since it's tucked off behind a store to the left as you travel down the main road. The inside is also a bit divey - for some reason I'm surprised this hasn't hit Guy Fieri's DDD show yet. Show up in anything fancier than a polo and jeans and you'll definitely stick out.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jake K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I've said this before, and it bears repeating. I've had a longstanding desire to be, even slightly, offended at a Mexican restaurant so that I can throw THE BIGGEST B-TCH FIT EVER and vituperatively yell, "HEY!! F-CK YOU, GRINGO!!" To me, "gringo" is one of the funniest insults out there, and I'd love to take it for a test drive.
As a general rule, when choosing a Mexican restaurant, eat at one that Mexicans prefer. When choosing an Italian restaurant, eat at one that Italians prefer. When choosing a Chinese restaurant, eat at one that Chinese prefer. When choosing a seafood restaurant, eat at one that fishermen prefer. You get the idea. So when I walked into Taquería La Oaxaqueña and saw Latino patrons, servers, kitchen personnel, and Mun2 on the televisions, I knew that this place is home to authentic Mexican cuisine. In fact, some of the staff exclusively speak Spanish, which led to some confusion and a free cow cheek huarache. :) Incidentally, I'm somewhat proud of myself for correctly pronouncing the menu items that I ordered (i.e., not being a major gringo) and for finishing all of my food, which is a remarkable feat considering the generous portion sizes.
I ordered a goat taco, cow cheek taco, and steak huarache. This was a great deal of food, especially for these prices. The tacos were quite good, as was the pork burrito that a friend allowed me to sample. This was my first taste of cow cheek, and I was impressed; the cow cheek is tender, with a gelatinous edge, and tastes familiar enough that even an unadventurous gringo would devour it without hesitation. That said, what I was most pleased with was the huarache. Do yourself a favor and order it. The crunch of the fried cornmeal topped with beans, lettuce, sour cream, cheese, and meat will turn you into a salivating customer for life.
And so, BELIEVE THE HYPE! Other yelpers are sooooo right to recommend this one. The food here is beyond extraordinary, and yelp proves its usefulness once again!
Yelp_Review.Name: Sidney E.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Cheap and delicious tacos! The Goat and Lengua tacos are absolutely delicious! The ingredients are fresh and flavorful and the salsa is spicy!
Yelp_Review.Name: Sarah F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Yep. Do beleive the hype. This is as good as it gets. The salsa is a must try. All the salsa are fresh and very tasty. The guacamole is really really good. Really as close to perfection in a taco as I've had.
Yelp_Review.Name: Emory B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: How is it that I have not reviewed this place before. We go all the time and love it every time. We feel guilty driving all the way to Jonesboro for Mexican but once we are there and had eaten we know exactly why. It is terrific and totally worth the drive! They have the best Al Pastor in the city no matter what form you get it in. Very authentic food.
Yelp_Review.Name: P K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Good authentic food and very good prices. Huge portions. Definitely a must go to establishment!
Yelp_Review.Name: Ashley W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Poor service I feel the group I was with was singled out for race reason. We are a group of professionals and couldn't get adequate service I will never eat here again
Yelp_Review.Name: Kane S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is the first time in my life that I have been to a Mexican restaurant and there were actual Mexican people eating there, roughly 80% to be exact. To say it was an authentic establishment would be an understatement. I had flautas which are chicken taquitos to us americans.They were not like any taquito I have had. The chicken was uber flavorful and the rice and toppings that came with it was really good. I also had Horchata, which is a rice water. I have never had anything like it and It was good stuff. It was an enlightening experience. After eating here I realized that in my life I have never really had Mexican food because the places I have tried pale in comparison to this place and seem completely different. If you ever run into someone who loves AUTHENTIC Mexican promptly send them here. If they want American Mexican you can send them to Agave.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tramaine W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Best authentic Mexican in Georgia! Mole is amazing. Great tamales! Awesome salsa bar with a variety of salsas including guacamole.
Its important to note that fancy mexican restaurants don't have good mexican food. So since this place has great food, be sure you aren't going for the decor.
Yelp_Review.Name: John P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Had a large party at work and came here to get a massive amount of chicken. They were on time with my large order and even helped me bring it to the car. The salsa bar was pretty intense, and all quite delicious.
I'd come back for a large catered event. I'll have to swing by soon just to grab lunch to check a normal portioned meal. Everyone working seemed very friendly and on their game. All the food was great, and my staff was employees were very happy.
Yelp_Review.Name: Paul S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Went here had the traditional Mexican tacos, the prices are great and the food is ok as well. The service however is not the best the waitresses are nice but don't expect for them to come to your table and check on you or ask if you need anything you'll have to track them down for that but overall it's ok
Yelp_Review.Name: Che J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
We were pleasantly surprised with Tanqueria La Oaxaquena. Great, inexpensive, food! Many of the other Yelpers hit the mark with their reviews. Not the fanciest establishment, but great friendly staff and food made up for it. We spent about $20-$25 and had enough for two people for two meals. Really beat any other place we could have stopped and was just outside of the craziness of Atlanta.
I LOVED their salsa bar. Homemade, deliciousness full of cilantro and spicy goodness.
Yelp_Review.Name: Liz M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Easily the best Mexican restaurant around. Had the pork burrito. Flavor was amazing. The amount was filling. The salsa is incredible. Price is perfect. Don't waste time. Do yourself and your palette a favor and try this place out.
Yelp_Review.Name: Andy S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
A find in a dining wasteland south of the city. Excellent value for the money, and that salsa bar just puts the crown on a great dining experience. Probably not for those who prefer their Mexican on the TB flavor profile; anyone adventurous should absolutely try it. We usually get the tlayuda with chorizo and have enough left for two meals the next day....
On occasion, it can be a while to get your food, especially prime dining hours. Do what one family did: Order dessert first and enjoy the flan (a huge portion that served the whole table)
Highly recommended -- new location is a big improvement over the cramped old one. One of these days we will explore the goat barbacoa platter.
Yelp_Review.Name: Birgitta W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
BEST. Salsa. Bar. Free guacamole? Yes!
Best Mexican meal I've had in years, really. Very sweet and attentive service-feels like family, like they really care whether you love it. I told our lady how amazing the mole sauce was and she brought over a nice side dish of it. Everyone reached over me to get some after tasting my
Chicken Mole Tamale: Massive masa bomb stuffed with tender chicken and perfect mole wrapped in banana leaf. One of the best I've had..UPDATE: had one 3/12 and it was dried out. They were super busy, and the food quality seemed to suffer.
Carnitas: Nice and crispy without being greasy.
Flautas: Dad got them, he didn't share, even though there were four.
Gorditas: They don't call them "little fat ones" for nothing. They are big, and so was my belly after eating it. I got beans and cheese, very nice.
We brought a flan to go. Noticed it was $5, but it felt like it weighed a pound. Will eat for breakfast. (Update: not good, tasted like it was made from a mix).
Great meal+Amazing deal=joyous me. Dinner and leftovers for four, $33.
Food coma alert! Portions are major.
Cheers~
Yelp_Review.Name: Heather N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I never knew Mexican food can taste so fresh and delicious. Wow just wow. The tacos taste like the tortillas were ground and made as I ordered them. Best Mexican place I been to, hands down.
Yelp_Review.Name: 4cardAhmed A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place is just ok. Customer service was great but it took forever for the food to come out. I have had better, also they are a bit over priced for what you get.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tonya L.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: We saw it on yelp and tried it today. It was not fancy but the service was good the restaurant was clean and the food was very fresh. Both meals tasted great and the price was very affordable
Yelp_Review.Name: Basil H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Who knew, you go south past the airport and you end up in Mexico. I'm guessing this is authentic because they had lots of dishes I had never heard of. The tlayuda was awesome, a giant mexican pizza. Looked like lots of other good options as well.
There weren't many gringos there, but they did speak English. The service was nice, but the food took a long time to get there. Overall, worth a diversion if you're near the airport.
Yelp_Review.Name: Rob P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Delicious, authentic food from Oaxaca! Had a chicken mole tamale for lunch and it was amazing. Best Mexican food I've had in Atlanta.
Yelp_Review.Name: TJ T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I love this place THE BEST !!!! Taco salad and tacos wish they had fried ice cream though :) would get it everyday
Yelp_Review.Name: Trini T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: After reading the reviews, what a disappointment. The guacamole was runny like a milk shake (clearly cut), runny beans, (should be pastry), the taco meat was burnt, and the service was bad.The only positive note was the corn chips were fresh, and the cheese dip had a great flavor.
Yelp_Review.Name: Holly B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
OMG... The burrito's here are the bomb!! I'm from California and I thought I had the best burrito there, but I am clearly wrong! I'm also Asian who can be quite picky with my food at times... so this review must mean a lot! I ordered the large lengua burrito and that was good for 2 meals, lunch & dinner. My burrito was loaded with meat, which is def. worth it! My dad ordered the pork tamale with green sauce and said it was a bit too spicy for him and liked the red sauce pork tamale better. For the most part he liked it though. I also ordered a side of rice and all I can say is... I can eat this rice all day, everyday.
The prices are well worth the food in my opinion. Large burrito for $5 something, tamales were $1.99 and the side of rice for $1.99!
I am definitely coming back here again before I head back to mediocre burritos in California...
Yelp_Review.Name: Tiffany S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The best Mexican food I have ever had. It may not look like much and the service is questionable, but the food you can't beat. The mole tamales are worth way more than $3.99!
Yelp_Review.Name: Jake K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Visiting from Birmingham AL, I stopped by not expecting much since I am so use to walking into Tex mex style places. As soon as I received my order I was shocked at the authenticity of the food. This is as authentic as you get with real street style taste from Mexican streets. Don't let the bland feel of the decor fool you before ordering. The food here is exceeds expectations! Thanks for the great dinner :)
Yelp_Review.Name: Gustavo P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: The food is superb!!! The taste is to die for!!! Very impressed. I work in the area, but will make the trip out there to bring my family. Good prices too!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Alicia J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: My co workers and I love the salsa bar it is the best. Everything tastes very fresh and authentic.
Yelp_Review.Name: Kim R.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
The well-travelled might thing of this as Mexico away from Mexico; I think of it as Buford Highway away from Buford Highway. Being intrigued by the Creative Loaving 100 Things to Eat Before You Die List, I planned a special lunch visit. The first thing to know: the tlayudas are huge. I am a big eater and eating one was a challenge that left me no room for dinner that night. Akin to pizzas in size, contents and density, these specialties are served on a giant crisp tortilla. Toppings include string cheese, avocados, tomato slices, meat of your choosing (pastor was a good choice), radishes (good addition to balance the proteins). It was a little tricky to eat, but it sure was good. Bring a friend or get a box, because it's really too much for even me to eat.
The restaurant appears to cater mostly to homesick immigrants, who packed the place when I was there. Communication with the servers was not a challenge. Service was friendly and attentive, but a little flaky, in that I respectfully declined chips and salsa (it does not appear to be free), declined them again, and then received a basket anyway. Food preparation was not fast, but it came out hot and delicious. Decor looks like a fresh renovation, with lots of big tiles and on the floor and half way up the walls. Seating was a bit more "institutional" and a little tight for my tastes, but reasonably comfortable nonetheless.
This place is a hidden treasure and Lord knows that Clayton County can use all the help it can get.
Yelp_Review.Name: Bill G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
First of all yelp has misspelled the restaurant's name is Taqueria La Oxaqueña not La Taqueria Oaxaquea or La Oaxaquena Taqueria.
Now to the review. Taqueria la Oxaqueña has beeen named of of the top 50 restaurants by The Atlanta Journal Constitution (ajc.com). I have been a recurring customer at the taqueria. As an American who lived in Mexico for 4 years I can tell you that this is the real deal. I really love their cow's cheek taco (Tacos de Cabeza) they are extremely moist and the meat almost melts in your mouth.
Other recommendations are tacos de chicharron (pork skin), al pastor, and carne asada (steak). However, if you are brave enough try their tripe tacos (tacos de tripa) really good too.
Also their tamales, sopes, and huaraches are to die for. Their ceviche is spectacular, and their shrimp tostada can be highly addictive. If you want a complete meal you can have their carne asada that comes packed with peppers, onion, nopalitos, avocados, white cheese, yellow rice, fried beans and a pile of tortilla all for less than $11.00.
Their service is very consistent. As soon as you step in everyone greets you. The place is usually pack with all types of Hispanic, hint hint..that means that the food they serve is truly authentic. Their prices are excellent too. Tacos are only 2.00 but they are HUGE. I can't eat more than 2 tacos without feeling full. The have certain dishes that they only make during the weekends, I believe "menudo" and pozole are two of them.
Also, I almost forgot have you ever tried a "Cubana Sandwich" (torta cubana) not to be confused with a "Cuban Sandwich". This is more like a kitchen sink sandwich but it is sooooo good. Try it someday, you won't regret it but please make sure if you are not into hot and spicy foods to tell them to HOLD the jalapeño.
One more thing, please remember that they moved recently. Their new place is near Sonny's BBQ and the gas station in Mt Zion.
Yelp_Review.Name: Liza C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best Mexican food in South Atlanta, tried many in the area and this is the Best! and best value!
Yelp_Review.Name: AJ A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place is AMAZING! I've had a lot of good Mexican food since I moved here, but this place is BY FAR, the best that I have had in the Atlanta area. Their sopes are so good and their prices are legit. West Coasters will be happy with this place.....
Yelp_Review.Name: Caitlin B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I eat here like every other day. I live the steak tacos. Their beans and rice is so yummy. I always get the fresh fruit juice of the day.
Yelp_Review.Name: Monet T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place is fantastic. The food is beyond words. Nice price and the salsa bar is great.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mr. X.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
It took me a long time to try this place. I had heard its good but I never went in. I'm not sure why but I regret not going in until today. To be honest, when I first walked in I thought it might be a bit of a mistake. The place feels a bit off. There are TVs speaking Spanish fairly loudly, the decor could probably use a bit of work but it all becomes worth it when you get the food.
The servers are extremely helpful almost to the point of annoyance. We were probably asked if we were ok at least a dozen times. It never got to the point of being really annoying but the potential is there. The servers were very helpful though and it is needed. The food here is what I imagine authentic Mexican to be, and to be honest, I had no clue what some of it was going in. The pictures were quite helpful and usually I'm against menu pictures but it helped me a lot here.
The initial food gotten at Mexican restaurants are always the tortilla chips, salsa and queso. It was no different here. The salsa was excellent. You could taste the tomato and it still had the chunks of vegetables in it. The salsa had a bit of kick which I love. Salsa is supposed to be a bit hot and this fits the bill of heat to perfection flavorable heat. The queso has a ton of cheese in it. It has enough to actually cling to the chip. There is nothing I hate more than dipping a chip in queso only to have it ALL fall off because it has no cheese to thicken it. That won't happen here.
My meal of choice was carne asada. It was divine. The steak was very flavorful and marinated to perfection. It was cooked with some tomatos, onions, and peppers. The peppers were jalapeno and actually had a bit of heat which was great. The refried beans still looked like beans not the mush you get at most places. The rice was good stuff as well and even had a few veggies in it.
To sum it all up, its authentic Mexican food it has some heat and it isn't the deadened flavors you get at chains across the suburbs of Atlanta. Give it a shot. You'll like it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jason N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
After reading all the reviews, my friends and I were excited to try it. We are only in town for a few days, and have some DELICIOUS FOOD, and fabulous service all over the city. welllllll, everything came to a screeching halt today. The salsa bar is good. They had several choices, but the guacamole was out. and it looked like for a while. the cilantro was fresh though.
We should have known when we sat down and were offered a table that was not clean. Really? you are going to seat me at a dirty table? I asked for a towel to clean the table, and the waitress cleaned it for me. A worker brought chips and salsa, which were good. That's where it all went bad. We were there at lunch, but it wasnt Slammed. It was busy, but don't restaurants like busy at lunch? I thought so. We ordered our food and drinks. A table sat down next to us and the waitress took their order at the same time. We sat for at least 15 minutes waiting for our drinks. The drinks came out, and my white queso, which is what started this entire quest in the first place. It was good, but bland. I spiced it up with some salsa and cilantro. We ran out of chips, and no more was brought out. The table that sat down after us got their food. A table down from us that sat down after us got their food. We finally had to request our food to go, since we didn't have time to eat it before we had to get back to work. We were there almost 40 minutes before we finally got our food to go. The waitress was rude, the food was marginal. In fast, i got their horchate and it was meh. My friend got enchiladas. They were like string cheese wrapped in a tortilla. I don't know if they did something to our food cause we needed to leave, or if the food was just not that good, but we all had bad tummies after we ate. and I only ate about 4 bites of my lunch. Kind of expensive for four bites. Yea, we won't go back, and would recommend people try a different place! Surly service, dirty, marginal food. Plenty of other restaurants in Atlanta!
Yelp_Review.Name: Lynn B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This place is terrifying and totally overwhelming. Do not eat here if you're a picky eater, there is nothing on the menu for you. Seriously. If you usually order chicken nachos or tacos at La Generic Suburban Mexican Restaurant, you're not gonna find that here.
Yelp_Review.Name: Mary K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: They have really stepped up their game in the service department. The food is among the best Mexican you are going to find in this area of the country.
Yelp_Review.Name: Blaire B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Born in bred in Clayton County (and currently working here), there isn't much about my old stomping grounds that I can actually rave about. Enter Taqueria La Oaxaquena. Game changer. Very glad my friend and I gave this place a shot back in their old locale. It is good enough for me to head to this side of town on a non-workday, so 5 stars!
I am a sucker for salsas, and dios mio, this place has 'em. Be prepared for your food to take a few minutes to come out (might I suggest a basket of chips and one of the several aforementioned salsas to kill time), but once it gets to you, you are in for a treat. I like to go with the bean and cheese gordita and an order of rice. The gorditas are substantial, and the order of rice is enough for two people.
There are several dessert offerings that I have never tried (always too full!), and they have TVs tuned into either Ranchero or modern Spanish-language music videos.
Not too shabby for something running out of an old Captain D's restaurant :)
Yelp_Review.Name: Melissa P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
While the food was excellent and the selection of authentic foods outstanding, the service was mucho slow. Don't get me wrong, the server was super nice and willing to explain what items were that were on the menu, but it took about 30+ minutes to get our food!! That's cool except the place was jumping with kids, including the ones in our party.
I ordered the Pork strip huarache and was not expecting for to be so gargantuous!!! It was just over a foot long and about 8" wide!!! There was probably a pound of pork on top! Since it was only $5, I also ordered two goat tacos (still thinking small portions) only to find that the TACOS were approximately a 1/2 lb a piece themselves!!! I was dumbfounded at the portions and I can put down some food!!
My friend ventured into ordering the giant tallyuda (spelling??) which the server described at a "two person meal". I'd like to see the thighs on those two people cuz my friend's a big boy and barely made it thru a 1/4 of the behemoth.
Definitely a family spot for all with a relaxed environment. If I lived close to it, it would be a regular spot. Make sure you hit the "salad" bar (I quoted that since there's not any "salad" like you think of being on a salad bar....) and try the yummy cactus and fiery hot marinated peppers.
Agreed, best Mexican food I've had, but don't expect any Americanized fare here!
Yelp_Review.Name: Britters B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Daniel was looking at a truck way down here and his rents were up in North Atlanta doing some business. They wanted to meet us for dinner and I got them to meet us here. I was really nervous because they are Maconers but were strangely excited about getting real Mexican (they lived in Cali for 15 years).
I ordered a chicken and green chile tamale, Al Pastor sope, and Asada (steak) medium burrito. It ended up being way too much food for me. So I have the burrito for today. :)
Tamale: Sigh this was as good as King Taco in L.A. Much better than the MSG loaded version served at Nuevo Laredo. This guy was also only $2.99.
Sope: If I could make love to a food this would be it. These are hard to find in Georgia and it was perfect. Sort of like a mini pizza, it's like a thicker tortilla with pinched edges. Lightly fried, served with meat, beans, lettuce, acidified cream, and some soft white cheese on top.
Burrito: I tried a bite of it last night and was slightly disappointed. I had ordered all the American garbage off of it and they still but it on. It's ok, I will be more insistent not to have so much damn filler in it next time.
Daniel got a pork tamale and chicken burrito. He was in a food coma by the end of it. His mom got a cheese quesadilla and his dad got the flauta platter. They both were very happy and groaning in delight from their orders.
Service wise the waitress was very kind and quick to fill our water cups. The restaurant was clean and the salsa bar was banging. I loved the corn salsa (spicy) and the pickled radishes.
He needs to pick up his truck tomorrow and guess where we are going for lunch tomorrow? I'm going to try the tacos next. :)
#Yelp365 - 42/365
Yelp_Review.Name: Nancy B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Superb, authentic, Mexican food! I'm from Texas where taquerias abound, and when I crave real tacos or tortas this is where I go.
Yelp_Review.Name: Michal J.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
A recent stop on the never-ending trek to find breakfast tacos for my boyfriend. He wants chorizo + eggs in a tortilla and i will go to the ends of the earth to find it for him so he can have sensory flashbacks to Honduras and Austin.
We headed down to TLA on a Saturday morning - they are open for breakfast daily. A few families were scattered and a few more trickled in.
Our server was a Druid Hills High student who chatted us up relentlessly about her summer job, travel, and parents and siblings. She was cute but it started to feel like a table for 3.
The tamales are the star here - we shared one and I think when we go back we'll stick exclusively to tamales. I opted for Chilaquiles which were huge and spicy with salsa verde - delicious but massive.
Z had tortillas with chorizo and eggs - the eggs were a little rubbery. Not sure I would cling to the huevos here, despite it being breakfast.
I enjoyed the fun salsa bar and we definitely loved the authenticity of the place. I had been to the old location and this one is a huge step up in size, cleanliness and just general sketchiness.
Worth the trip for authentic mexican. A fun breakfast but don't go too egg-heavy.
Yelp_Review.Name: Sarah M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Great Food...Excellent Service...Reasonably Priced...Authentic Mexican...Will Not Hesitate To Return...
Yelp_Review.Name: David E.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Even mid-afternoon, this place is packed -- and for good reason. The food here is outstanding.
Although the menu is quite extensive, I came here for the tacos. On their own, they run between $1.99 and $2.50 a piece, which isn't particularly cheap. Instead, I went with the al pastor platter ($8.50), which comes with enough pastor to fill five tortillas, along with beans, rice, and a small salad.
The large portion of (likely pan-fried) pastor was quite flavorful, owing in particular to the generous amount of sliced onions they had thrown into the mix. The tortillas were somewhat thick, quite large in diameter, and durable enough that I didn't have to double layer them. The usual cilantro and chopped onion were there, of course, along with a few extra raw vegetables on the side; the green and red salsas were both pleasant enough (check out the salsa bar); and the meal is accompanied by a few green onion bulbs and jalapeno peppers, both grilled. Satisfying.
The selection of aguas is a bit limited -- I went with the melon over the horchata and only one other choice -- but what's there is solid.
This place is probably a little out of the way for many people, being so south OTP, but it's worth stopping by if you're in the area. That's, of course, of no consequence with regard to my rating.
Yelp_Review.Name: Robert C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best Mexican food in years. The staff was very friendly , and they even gave us free dessert . We will most definitely be coming back. I real gem in the rough.
Yelp_Review.Name: Everette N.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
After reading John Kessler's article about Taqueria in the AJC and finding that Creative Loafing voted it the best Mexican restaurant two years in a row, it was time to make a journey to Jonesboro to try this place out. It's not your typical Tex-Mex joint. There are no combinations and no frozen margaritas, but judging from the clientele sitting down as we walked in, we knew we were in for some delicious authentic Mexican cuisine.
Nothing disappointed (including the service) and there was a wide variety of things to pick from. One notable was the tlayuda. It's like Mexican pizza. You get a huge tortilla topped with your choice of meat (asada was awesome), refried beans, jalapenos, radishes, tomatoes, lettuce and quesillo (like Mexican string cheese). The mole chicken (also served with rice and beans) was also impressive. Some of you have probably been to Nuevo Laredo and tried the mole there, but this mole was more flavorful and the consistency was better. They even have tortas and tamales featuring the mole. You've gotta try it. The tacos are also a good deal for $1.99. Try the lengua (beef tongue). The salsa bar featured five different salsas and they even had cactus which were perfect accompaniments for chips and on top of our main dishes. Finally, tres leches was a perfect ending to the meal for dessert.
We will definitely be making a return trip in the near future to try the other menu items that we just didn't have room for and I can't wait to have my leftover tlayuda for lunch. Like John Kessler said in the AJC article, "Again, I ask: Is there a better Mexican restaurant in the city?"
Yelp_Review.Name: Destin D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: My family and I have been to this restaurant a couple of times. I had the bean and cheese sopes. Its pretty good with the exception of the slightly bitter taste. Not sure if it was the sour cream or melting cheese. Other than that it was good. Also had their tacos. Has steak and alpastro. They were average. It was missing a little salt. But I was really impressed with the hand made tortilla. Overall it was good had a few minor details that need to be fix but nothing that will stop me from coming again.
Yelp_Review.Name: Diana B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
For someone bored by the Mexican places around midtown, Taqueria La Oaxaquena's diverse menu is refreshing. It's not the same old #1-#57 pick some combination of chicken or beef tacos, enchiladas and burritos plus rice and beans.
They've got all of the stuff you can't find there: goat meat dishes, cow cheek, tongue and trip dishes, pozole (on Sat. and Sun.), pork al pastor, carnitas, pickled pigs feet, and a bunch of Oaxacan regional stuff. Last time I got myself a goat taco, an al pastor gordita, and a banana leaf tamale (the filling is chicken mole).
Liked:
* Extensive salsa bar -- they've got a variety of salsas, pico de gallo, pickled vegetables and a bunch of other stuff.
* The goat taco and pork al pastor gordita were excellent.
* I like how the tacos come with a lot of "fixings". They give you a whole jalapeno, onion and radishes (along with the other stuff available at the salsa bar).
* The gordita comes with a side of shredded Oaxacan cheese which is great to add to the gordita and tacos.
* The steak a la mexicana was tender, not chewy or dry and the flavor was good with a nice level of spice.
* Freshly made tortillas
Not much I didn't like, but minor caveats:
* The banana leaf tamale didn't have enough filling, IMO. There was too much masa and not enough mole and chicken.
* Some of the a la carte prices are a bit high.
* You have to pay for chips and salsa. That's a very minor gripe, but the vast majority of Mexican places don't charge so it stands out by comparison.
Next time I'll have to try a Tlayuda. Also, the desserts looked interesting -- I always want to get tres leches cake when I see it on a menu since it's good but I hardly ever see it places I go.
Yelp_Review.Name: David H.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is a wonderful Mexican restaurant better then La Parilla and La Hacienda. It also has great lunch specials! It really is worth a try you won't regret it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Toneysha I.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Somehow, I manage to finagle my weekend errands so I land here at meal time. Of course, I love this taqueria enough that any time is meal time when I am in the neighborhood. We always order way too much food - oh well, lunch the following day was delicious, too.
Favorites - gordita with the pork ribs in green sauce. YUM!
Huaraches (thick tortilla-like vessel) with refried beans, meat of your choice (carnitas this time), lettuce, crema, sprinkling of cheese.
Sope (thick masa cake) with chorizo and toppings. Delicious, not too greasy from the chorizo.
Tacos - any meat choice works here, too - al pastor has just the right amount of pineapple/sweetness. One perfect tortilla, a good amount of meat, chopped onions, cilantro and a squeeze of lime. It all works perfectly.
I have only had the tlayuda once years ago and keep meaning to try it again. We just start ordering one of everything else and never leave room for it.
Service was fast and friendly, Latin variety show on the TV was entertaining (and not so family-friendly), salsa bar rocks! Hmmm....how soon can I get back down to the Southlake area again?!
Yelp_Review.Name: Randy D.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Super fresh homemade . Fun fresh salsa bar. Friendly service . A nice surprise for a boring commercial area.
Yelp_Review.Name: John G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Anyone who follows my reviews knows I love good Mexican food. My favorite spots for good, cheap Mexican have had to take a back seat to this place lately. I would go here all the time if not for it being located in old town Jonesboro. Since I started going to grad school in Southeast Georgia, I have been hitting this place often on the way to and from school. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu. Everything is delicious and cheap. The salsa bar is not to be missed and is perhaps the best in ATL. My favorite is the burrito with your choice of meat and done "all the way."
Yelp_Review.Name: Robert M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Delicious food! And super reasonable prices too.
Hands down the best quesadilla I've ever had in my life... and it was vegetarian :) My brother had the puerco con salsa verde - he said it was "OK", but I don't trust his food expertise haha. The meal came with a huge basket of tortilla chips and salsa, which were yummy. The salsa bar is there in case you need refills too. The spicy garlic salsa - I didn't the name - was absolutely marvelous.
Service was very friendly and our waiter helped us decide which foods we wanted; it was especially useful for me, since I don't eat meat.
We had a flan and rice pudding for dessert. Skip the rice pudding next time - nothing special - but DO get the flan! oh, a HUGE HUGE slice of flan for only $3.50! The one thing that could have been better was the temperature of the flan - it should always be ice-cold and firm, but the taste was still awesome.
Will be returning!
Yelp_Review.Name: Lina V.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Hands down, this place has delicious, AUTHENTIC Mexican food! I loved everything I ordered and this will become my new spot when I'm craving south of the border fare! You know you've found a great spot for Mexican food when almost everyone in the place is Mexican!
Yelp_Review.Name: Shannan M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Had read about them for a while, and finally we were on the southside and decided to stop in. Spent a bit over 50 bucks on take out, but it was a huge amount of food. They were very friendly and the manager even gave us some complementary rice pudding to nosh on while we waited.
Mole chicken: large leg and large thigh in mole, w/rice. Excellent.
Tlayuda with steak: essentially a Mexican pizza. Put some of their sauces on it for some extra kick. Yum.
Carne Asada: huge amount of beef, onions, peppers. I cut up the beef so we could eat it on tortillas. They gave plenty of tortillas.
Chicken enchiladas: The red sauce is somewhat hot, but they were very good.
A couple of tamales. We got some rice, but some meals came w/rice. We also got some beans, which were excellent. Next time, more beans.
This all fed 4 adults well, and we had leftovers for two that took us a couple more days to eat.
It was all excellent, everything is probably even a buck or two less than the same things at some other Mexican restaurants.
It's a bit of a drive, but if you are ITP or on the southside, you can get there in under 20 minutes probably. Go!
Yelp_Review.Name: jim b.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
What am I doing here? I'm vegetarian and can't eat corn! But yum... the few dishes I can eat here are absolutely delicious, and make Jodi happy because I'm willing to drive OTP on the *south* side of Atlanta for this stuff.
I had the huevos divorciados ("divorced eggs"), three eggs over easy with green chile sauce on some and red chile sauce on others. It came with beans and rice and five small flour tortillas, making it a damn good $6.95 "breakfast" (available all day).
She had the chicken flautas. Ordinarily she's not a fan of sour cream, but the crema here suited her just fine on top of the cigar-sized rolls of chicken inside fried corn tortilla, and all of that topped by lettuce and avocado, and this, too, came with rice and beans.
How in earth did we find room for the pastel de tres leches, a Rubik's Cube-sized slab of coconut cake swimming in sweetened evaporated milk? Taste it. You'll see.
Yelp_Review.Name: Ben O.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Fresh delicious food! Nice people. Wish I lived closer, I'd be here once a week.
Yelp_Review.Name: Susan T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
So, here's the thing....
I was waxing philosophic to a friend about the lack of quality Taqueria's in Atlanta, I thought maybe I was just looking in the wrong places, but after months of searching I had given up and resigned to turning my kitchen into Bianca's Taqueria whenever I might be in the mood for a kick ass veggie taco. That was until there was La Oxaquena...
La Oaxaquena had me at "Hola" the menu does not disappoint, they have every kind of Torta, Flauta, Taco, Quesadilla, and Tamale you could imagine. On my trip I had a cheese, guacamole quesadilla and a veggie and cheese gordita. Since becoming a vegetarian I sometimes find it difficult to fully enjoy some of my favorite foods sans meat, the flavor isn't always the same, but La Oaxaquena has filled me with such vegetarian delight and flavor I'll never doubt my decision to go veg ever again.
My quesadilla was wonderful, the tortilla was crisp yet soft, the cheese was melty and gooey but not greasy, my gordita was heaven, fluffy masa formed into a cake, and then grilled crispy on the outside and filled with cheese and lettuce, sour cream, guacamole and tons of salsa. Its no surprise to any of my friends that the ultimate dining experience for me includes the right balance of crunchy and and crispy textures, a trip to this Taqueria leaves me beyond satisfied....
This place is a little out of the way, but the service is good, the portions are large, and the waitstaff is helpful ad patient, 5 stars all the way.
Yelp_Review.Name: Bianca W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Love this place. Great food, good service. There was a slight delay last time-- the one day I was actually in a hurry to eat and leave quickly-- but otherwise, they're speedy and friendly. The friendly sombrero-wearing gentlemanstatue out front welcomes you to dine (if it is around Christmas, he may be dressed as Santa!)
As for the eats, I recommend the gordita with huevos in it. SO GOOD. It's like a delicious, spicy, puffy breakfast... thing (that thing being a gordita). If you order two gorditas, you will probably be very, very full afterwards. One gordita + one taco seems a bit more sensible. Lots of meats to choose from for tacos; the chorizo taco makes for a nice breakfast combo with the huevos gordita, if you're into that kind of thing (and I AM.)
Two people can probably share the order of rice and be satisfied.
Get the grapefruit/Toronja Jarritos. It's the best!
Yelp_Review.Name: Gray W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best Mexican food in GA period. It reminded me of my mom's cooking. Genuine Mexican. I ordered the menudo and a pastor taco. The salsas are to die for they are hand made. I lived and raised in Mexico and the food is genuine taste. I joined the service and had traveled all over the place and is difficult to find good Mexican food outside of los angeles or san diego. My family ordered the puerco en chile verde and it was very good it even had nopales on it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Andy O.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Kind of divey but the food is awesome. Had one of their famous tlayudas and while I wouldn't drive out of my way for one, if you happen to in the neighborhood, definitely try one.
Yelp_Review.Name: Heather S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
you know is good when all the staff speaks spanish and spanish tv is on in the background. and def order the huge orange juice is nice to share for 2
i usually dont eat mexican food outside of mexico but this place is pretty good. and compare to everything close by, that's ur only safe bet.
solid 4!!
Yelp_Review.Name: Donald F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
JUST DO IT ALREADY!
Hands down, the best mexican food in Atlanta.
BARING WITNESS:
I felt the spots forming at the back of my head... I knew that the spots would soon become beads... In five minutes, these beads would turn to trickles... I felt it coming, it didn't care that it was coming, it came in a downpour, and I still couldn't stop eating... The habaneros kicked me, then kicked me some more, and then I kept begging for more pain... I couldn't help myself.
WHAT I HAD:
- The Drink: Horchata which came in a super-sized cup. Cool, refreshing, sweet, without being too syrupy or runny. Nice...
- Chips: They're not free, but due to the quality of the salsa bar here, you MUST order a batch. Absolutely mandatory to try the salsa bar.
- Entree Uno: Gordita with Pork in Green Chile Sauce. Simply put, awesome. Hot, stewed pork smothered with home made green chile, poured between the corned layers. Really hits the spot.
- Entree Dos: My poor, rich mid-section... Tlayuda with Chorizo. For those who don't know, its sort of like a mexican Pizza. On a layer of baked tortilla, toppings include meat (your choice), avacado, radish, tomato, fried jalapenos, and stringed cheese... A group came in just as I started eating, and the young lady asked me what it was... About 15 minutes later, she was getting one topped with carne asada (grilled steak). "Nuff said.
-The Salsa Bar: Unlike other spots I've been too, these guys, actually put everything on ice, to keep it fresh. Just as I was ordering, I saw them pouring in the buckets of ice, before placing in the various salsas, which included the hot, green chile, pico de gallo, the radish, habaneros, guac, and an assortment of mixes that normally include onions, carrots, jalapenos, or habaneros. Great stuff that was fresh, and really gives the food an extra kick.
HOW TO GET THERE:
Not as bad as you think. Take I-75 south and the 2nd exit OTP is Hwy 41 south. Left at the first light, and its on your immediate right. Just go already!
FINAL WORDS:
If its decor you want, go to any overpriced, underflavored tex-mex joints that are everywhere. But if you want no frills, authentic flavor, then make a trip down to Jonesboro. Well worth the hype.
Yelp_Review.Name: Canyouwoowoo W.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: OMG! Everything was amazing. Watch out for the green salsa. It is dangerously hot...and some of us like that. Try it all - even the cactus salad in the salsa bar.
Yelp_Review.Name: Alex B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This was ok. I had the chicken flautas. I've had better. With that being said, my husband loved it.
Yelp_Review.Name: Libra M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: I took mom here with some trepidation as we normally eat at La Parilla, and I was afraid this would be TOO authentic for her. But she made me take her to Southlake, so I made her eat here! She loved it. Disappointed at first that she couldnt get a margarita, but when the food arrived she was amazed at the size and the fun. Everyone was nice, that salsa bar is the bomb, the food so plentiful we had the leftovers for dinner. I made her get a cows cheek taco, since I wanted to try it, it was Soooo good, but its funny how some people wont like it because of its name. I would get that again. She liked her steak tacos alot. The bill said "Taco americano", bless her! I liked my Tlayuda. Busy- 3pm saturday and it was jammin! At first only mexicans! Good sign!
Yelp_Review.Name: Mark B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Completely authentic Mexican food. Beef tongue and beef cheek tacos were fantastic. But they couldn't hold a torch to the Pozole soup. That was the best soup I can remember eating. The pork knuckles in the soup were a nice touch. The guacamole on the salsa bar was also fantastic. My only complaint is they put way too much salt in the chorizo. Lighten up on the salt. We can always add salt if we want it, but we can't take it out.
Yelp_Review.Name: R P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best AUTHENTIC Mexican in Atlanta. Nothing fancy; just great food. The tacos, tamales, and horchata are the best around. And the salsa bar is awesome!
Yelp_Review.Name: Augustus G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Sweet Madre de Dios.
If you are a gringo, you are likely to be the only one in the place. If you are put out by the sound of MTVLatino coming at you just a little bit too loud, then you might not be in the place for long. But if you are looking for authentic, lovingly made food from southern Mexico, you will leave very, very happy.
The tamales, green with chicken, red with pork, and option three with mole, are out of this world and insanely inexpensive. Order extra. They freeze nicely.
But the orgasm on a plate is the Tlayuda, a signature dish designed as an appetizer for three or four is an excellent meal for a single glutton. Think of the world's largest corn tortilla (14? inches across), topped with everything you could think of, including at least three kinds of cheese. I added on the little pork cracklings (other options include steak, chicken and extra cheese), and its a meal I've -- literally -- dreamed about ever since.
No cervezas, though. Bummer.
Yelp_Review.Name: David B.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: You'd never think that the best Mexican would be in Jonesboro, GA. Hell, you'd never think of Atlanta's best dining spots would be here. But it is. It's a straight shot down 75. Regarding Mexican food, this stands out more to me than any place in the city, including Buford highway. This place is no frills. It's all about the food. The service is good. The decor is plain. But these are not bad things. I got a kick out of the fact that when we arrived, they assumed we spoke Spanish. That was already a plus. This is an impressive menu. I asked our waitress what her favorite item was. Her response: "Everything." I ordered the tlayuda. I don't speak Spanish, so I assume "tlayuda" means "can feed four people." This thing was a monstrous piece of art. It's a large fried tortilla loaded with Oaxaca cheese, refried beans, chorizo (that's what I ordered), avocado, and lettuce. If there's any dish in recent memory where I could suppress that part of my brain that signals when you're full, this is the one. So many textures and flavors, that in a matter of a few bites this was rocketing up my list of favorite dishes in the city. This dish was exciting to eat. So first impression? It's settled for me. If I have a Mexican craving, I'm looking no further (though it is far). I can't wait to try everything else on the menu. This place is awesome.
Yelp_Review.Name: Jeff M.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
Having been in Atl for quite a while, i kno there's quality mexican food everywhere. And even out in the Morrow area there's this little quaint restaurant. I've been to La Oaxaquena quite a few times now and its been consistent every time i've been. I usually come during lunch since i would never be in the neighborhood at sundown. Even in the daytime its iffy but the mexican food is so damn good here.
So when you are driving to Oaxaquena be aware that its on the southeast corner of Mount zion and tara blvd. The sign is a bit faded so you might miss it. Its right across the street from Mrs. Winners if that helps. The parking lot is a bit run down and the outside seems a bit tacky but when i go to a mexican restaurant i don't expect much in terms of decor. If there is a lot of decor i usually know my wallet is about to take a hit. Walking into the restaurant you will be greeted by a large statue of a rather stout mexican fellow with sombrero and all. The first thing i noticed after the stout sombrero wearing statue was the salsa bar. Im not sure of the official names but it had ure run of the mill salsa, tomatillo salsa, cactus salad, a roasted pepper salsa, and a few pickled items (my fav being the pickled jalapenos). Soon after a waitress will greet you and you will be seated.
The first time i came to the restaurant i was pleased to see a large contingent of mexican patrons. Its like going into a chinese restaurant and seeing chinese people. if they are eating here the food has to be decent. After giving my drink order i scanned the expansive menu. They had quite a bit on there. of course tacos and burritos were the staples but there were also a whole list of soups, entrees, and tamales. Since i usually come for lunch i settled for the grande burrito (which is filling enough for someone who eats a decent portion size. Their large burrito comes only with the burrito but for $5.75 its a good size and the salsa bar makes up for the sides that i would've got. My favorite burrito is the steak. It comes rolled with sour cream, cheese, rice, and beans. The steak is cooked well but has bits of fat which make it tender. The burrito also comes with a roasted pepper which is quite delicious. On the side I'll pile on some cactus salad and pickled jalapenos which comes with any meal. My buddies have tried the tamales and have stated for the price it can't be beat and the tortas are ok but I'd still have to go with El Pastor on Buford for a good quality tortas. I haven't experienced much on the menu besides the burritos, tamales, tortas, or tacos but have seen the other patrons order quite regularly.
Overall La Oaxaquena is a quaint little mexican restaurant that serves good food, for good prices. the staff is friendly and speak fluent english so u'll never be guessing what they are saying. if you don't mind spanish music videos laden with scantily clad women playing on the flat screens then come on down to La Oaxaquena and you won't be disappointed.... happy eats!
Yelp_Review.Name: Vincent K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: My friends and I chose this place because of all the great reviews. When we read "authentic" we didn't realize this meant goat and cow tongue. That's truly authentic which is great but people should really realize that before you go. Yes they have basics such as quesadillas but they are with dark meat chicken.. Gross. Yes, I know I am used to the more tex mex but I've had Mexican food while actually in Mexico.. As authentic as you can get.. and it was delicious. This.. Not so much. We were the only non Latinos in the place which I personally was completely fine with but it was hard to get service and the waitress walks over and says "you want quesadillas?" Lol!! Quite an assumption.. I started to order the cow tongue just for principal! Ha ha! But ol whitey ordered the quesadilla! Guess she saw that coming. This place is obviously great for some but take these things into account when making your decision. :)
Yelp_Review.Name: Jen P.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
First off, let me just say that I wouldn't know an "authentic" Mexican dish if it sat up, barked twice, and ran off chasing its tail. (wait, maybe that's authentic Korean food... Hold on hold on, I'm a Korean so I'm allowed)
Anyway, I do know good food and this place has it. I "found" the place back when it was in its strip mall roots, and while food was excellent there, seating was limited so it ruled itself out on several occasions. The new place -- apparently an old Captain D? -- is much larger and keeps the famous salsa bar. We went around 11AM and it was almost empty so I thought maybe the food quality went down, but never fear, as we were finishing up around noon, the place was closed to jammed and we had no doubts about the food.
My wife ordered... something. I can't remember because I ordered costillas en salsa roja and it was great. It's a pork rib dish with red sauce (also can be had en salsa verde), slow cooked and breaking apart with just a slight pressure from your fork. Excellent dish. $5.99 lunch special and comes with a drink in a huge styrofoam cup. Refill is a $1 but, seriously, it's enough to douse the flames you set in your mouth by sampling all the options on the salsa bar. I tend to drink a lot while I eat, but I still left with about a 3rd of drink still in the cup. I piled on some onion and habanero with (maybe) lime juice, pickled jalapeno, radish (great for extinguishing fires in your mouth), and several different salsa. Of the salsa, only one was truly hot, a habanero salsa the staff kindly labeled "super extra hot." Others were mild to low-medium range, so if you visit and get emboldened by these lesser salsa and take this "super extra hot" salsa lightly, prepared to have your sinus ventilated through the roof of your mouth. And understand: what goes in, must come out. A day later to be sure, but it does.
I also ordered carnita taco and chorizo. Chorizo was meh but canitas was excellent.
Yelp_Review.Name: Chae A.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: this place is the real deal -- real mexican food !! it is very tasty and reasonably priced -- the place is a bit of a dive, but the food is worth it
Yelp_Review.Name: Dan K.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Finally my search for authentic delicious Mexican food is over. This is the best Mexican food in the Atlanta area.
Yelp_Review.Name: Susanna C.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: OK, I enjoy Mexican food but sadly my family doesn't enjoy the authentic only mediocre stuff. I am disappointed they do not have queso fundido (in fact there were querulous looks when asked) however the rest of the menu is bountiful and far ranging in choices usually not found. That being said, any food ordered will be satisfying and more than sufficient. Carne lingua is exceptionally tender, tamales, sopes, burritos, cerviche, all good. I did not care for their chorizo...dry and overcooked.
Yelp_Review.Name: john k.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment:
I read about this place in the Creative Loafing and went there last week to check it out. It was really good! I am vegetarian so sometimes it's hard to find things to eat at Mexican restaurants, but this one had a few choices. I got the Tlayuda, and it was quite good. Very interesting Oaxacan cheese that I've never had before. My friend got gorditas which were very tasty. This is now one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in metro Atlanta, although I still prefer Nuevo Laredo Cantina.
Looking forward to going back to try more items off the menu. They are open past 10pm too, which is a plus.
Yelp_Review.Name: Tyler T.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: We have frequented this place for about a year and had excellent service and food. That being said, we were very disappointed with our meal on a recent Sunday afternoon. The chips, salsa, and salad bar were spot on, as usual; but our entrees and the service were not up to par. We ordered the green chicken and red pork tamales and could barely find any meat in them. I ordered a side of Mexican rice, but, after 3 reminders, it never came. I hope this experience was a fluke. We've always eaten here during the week, so maybe it was a different staff. I certainly hope this is the case, because we have become quite fond of Taqueria La Oaxaquena.
Yelp_Review.Name: deborah m.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Virtually everything on the menu at this taqueria is outstanding and it is hard to go wrong with whatever you order. Most people travel the distance for their tlayudas, which are 12-inch tortillas smothered in every topping imaginable and your choice of meat--the chorizo is my favorite. The salsa bar will knock your socks off with choices like a smoky red salsa and a bright green version thick with avocado.
Yelp_Review.Name: Blissful G.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: This is probably the best Mexican I have had since moving to Atlanta. They have a lot of specialties that are hard to find elsewhere, such as sopes and huaraches, and an assortment of meats that can't be beat. I had a tamale and two sopes (carnitas and cabeza), both of which I would highly recommend. The staff was very quick and courteous. I have no complaints. I can't wait to go back and try more of their food.
Yelp_Review.Name: Andrew S.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Wow! I decided to go here, after reading all the good reviews.. I ordered the Tlayuda, with chorizo. OMG it was sooo good. The staff is super friendly, and the salsa bar is awesome.
Yelp_Review.Name: Fresh F.

Yelp_Review.Review_Comment: Best Mexican food in southeast U.S. Simply amazing menu selection, the food is just fantastic across the board.
Yelp_Review.Name: john m.
